Reviews.Author: Rus
Reviews.Content: Mary's HASH HOUSE not to be confused with the hash house a go go, is an awesome breakfast spot! Chicken and waffles were spot on. I got 1/2 the chicken, perfect amount of seasoning, crisp skin, and juicy meat! If that wasn't enough it came with home made grits and 2 eggs.  The portions didn't even fit on one plate! Service was very attentive and personal as well!   If you like going to a breakfast spot that doesn't have overblown Vegas Strip pricing and hungover party people then you should definitely give this place a go.

Reviews.Author: Maia
Reviews.Content: For a girl who's trying to maintain her size 4, this place's corned beef hash makes it down right hard.  Their corned beef hash is the best in town.  It's homemade.  Their jams are also homemade and very yummy.  I've been going here for years and the owners are just the sweetest things.  It's a cozy family restaurant and you can taste the love in their corned beef and homemade jams.    I do agree with some of the other reviewers regarding service.  It's a hit or miss.  It really depends if they are busy or not.  But don't let it discourage you from going.  This is place is a total find.  But if I only had $20 and I had to choose a breakfast spot.... sorry Hash House, I truly like your corned beef hash but that darn Cracked House, um I mean Cracked Eggs wins.

Reviews.Author: Phillip
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome... I feel bad for not trying the Hash, but I've never had it and didn't feel adventuresome that day. Got a plain jane two egg breakfast that was great. What I did like, was the jam! They had a bunch of off the wall jams, not like the usual strawberry or grape, but Jalepeno (awesome, not spicy!) or watermelon!  Service was great. Not overly pushy but fast and courteous. Never ran out of coffee and my cup was always warm.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll try one of the different kinds of Hash breakfasts!

Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: Not impressed... The food was sub par and the service was terrible! They seem understaffed and for a crowded restaurant on a Sunday morning 2 chicks weren't cutting it... I won't go back, breakfast was  eh  at best..

Reviews.Author: Eliza
Reviews.Content: First time here, its a simple old school style place.  You pick where to seat if tables are open to be seated, they dont have a lot of workers so the service its a bit slow but the busboy that we got was very nice and attentive to our needs.  We wait for a good minute for the food but my goodness it was delicious!!!  Very good food quality and quantity, it was worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: WT
Reviews.Content: Not bad as diner food goes. Had eggs over easy & rye toast. Just wish the toast was browner than I received.  Not bad at all.

Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: Delicious!  A wonderful restaurant with everything you want in a classic breakfast place!

Reviews.Author: Trung
Reviews.Content: I love this place so much!!! It's just a shame it's a little far from where I live. Great Food at a reasonable price, Great and friendly service, love the atmosphere of it all! I usually get the chicken hash, and for jellies; watermelon and passion fruit. So looking forward to coming back in the early mornings!!!

Reviews.Author: Mrs.
Reviews.Content: BAD BAD BAD!  Came here for breakfast on a Friday morning with my family.  Walked in and the place was busy.     Seat yourself  sign was up so that is what we did.  The counter was full of people watching the tv, the front room was busy and since we had a party of 7, we had no choice but to go to the adjacent room.  DISGUSTING...we walked into the room and noticed a man sitting at a table and no one else; and that could be because all the tables in that room were dirty except for two tables that we managed to move together to accommodate our party of 7.  I looked at the clock and it was 9:50 when we sat down.  My son asked if he could stand by the doorway to watch tv, so I let him.  10:10, no one has come to our table to take our order.  However, the one server did manage to yell at my child when she came into the room to delivery the food to the one man that was sitting at the table next to us.  Again, she walked out of the room without acknowledging us...taking our order or apologizing to my child.  So this restaurant has been here for 20 years?  Really???  Then maybe in those 20 years the owners of this restaurant would have learned that you NEED more than one server and perhaps hire someone to clean the tables as customers leave.    You do know that is a health violation right????    Your food might be  Good  but please, its not that good to where people are going to put up with the bullshit attitude of your server and the disgusting conditions of your restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: This Sunday morning was mothers day, so we knew if we went out for breakfast it would be busy, and choosing the right place may be key in the amount of wait time we would endure.  Our timing was just right, as we walked in a table came up and we sat down, only to see the crowds begin.  Because they were busy, it took a while for the server to come take our order and it took even longer for the food to come.  I got a typical breakfast with scrabbled eggs, bacon and toast.  The best part of the meal was home made jams.  They bring around a tray of several different selections and let you choose, but you get only one choice.   I got a mixed berry and it reminded me of the jams my grandmother had made, rich in color, berry flavor and texture was just right.  The jams and the price was just about the only thing special here, I would go back, but choose a less busier morning.

Reviews.Author: Nadia
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty good. They make their own jams and they were all amazing, I had the waffle which was also good. I loved that it was easy to eat and not too crunchy.  They have amazing cinnamon roll flavored anything as well.

Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Asked my cab dirver where can i get a good breakfast and he said the Hash house. I said ok. it was very good.massive size. the meat they brought was so big i could not finish it. If you need meat on your bones the first thing in the AM. HASH house if for you.  Visited November 2010

Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: We love this place!!! We try to tell everyone about this restaurant. The hashes are each delicious, hearty and completely homemade. Mary, the owner, creates her own jams and jellies from scratch- a score of varieties like green apple-jalepeno, tomato, cherry, apple butter, even habanero! The eggs are always cooked to perfection. You gotta check this place out!

Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I love this place. I would go all the time and now that I don't live in Las Vegas anymore, I make sure I stop by for breakfast when I make it back to town.  The staff is great and very friendly. Food is great. What else can you ask for? Oh yeah, they also have strong coffee.   Amazing

Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this place on my last visit to Vegas. The food was great servers were friendly and it had a great home type feeling. I love the fact that they make pretty much everything from scratch. And that includes their own blend of coffee and jam! If you want to scape Denny's and ihop this place is awesome. The only thing that can use some improvement is to get more staff. Wait for food and service is more than I'm use to.

Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place!!! I am soooo impressed with the quality of food! So fresh, the turkey hash was delicious! Eggs were good, toast good, hash browns good, and the combination of all of that on the plate with the Smokin' Habanero Sauce made it AMAZING!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dennison
Reviews.Content: Place is old school..with great service and awesome food..and homemade jelly  and homemade cinnamon rolls!

Reviews.Author: Cleo
Reviews.Content: From 4/26/16 The mother in law was in town that week and wanted to try one of the breakfast places we have out here, so we took her to Mary's Hash House. When you come in it's like an old school diner in the country which is awesome, I appreciate a place that has that sort of charm.  We sat down; our server was the type of lady you would find in a place like this; she had a dry sense of humor which can go either way depending on a person sensitivity level. Luckily, I speak dry wit, so I found her hilarious!  The menu is simple here, not a huge selection which I don't mind sometimes. I ordered the waffles with strawberries which I substituted the eggs for hash browns. The waffles were excellent, but the hash browns were pretty bland. They could use a little flower for sure.   Other than that, I like this place and will return.

Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: Tired of the long lines and crowded brunches, we visited a local family breakfast place called Mary's Hash House. Their menu includes super tasty and vast omelettes, hashes, waffles and eggs but the real treat of this place is their homemade jam.   Take a look at my blog post about my trip to Las Vegas and this delish breakfast place!   http://lagamio.com/2014/04/24/las-vegas/

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I had to leave the strip to hit the jackpot!  We were greeted by Mary, the Hash House owner and Martha was our server. Mary was surprised that I knew her name, but I always come well prepared after I've done my Yelp research. I knew her face. She had a welcoming demeanor and a kind heart. There was a family with two children that had been waiting in front of the restaurant when we came in, she went outside and asked the family to come inside and cool off. That was awesome! Five stars Mary! I don't care what your food tastes like.  Sooooo... The food is fantastic! The Raspberry jam made me exclaim out loud. They offered me Orange, Cherry, Raspberry & Jalapeño flavored. All the jams are homemade by Mary. I grabbed Cherry and Raspberry and that surprised me because I abhor the seeds from raspberries, but it was great and fairly seedless.  This will be my new breakfast stop in Vegas instead of a buffet. The food was cleaner, better tasting and reasonably priced. Also, I believe in supporting small business owners.

Reviews.Author: Dolli
Reviews.Content: Fresh eggs! Home cooking! Great coffee! Isn't Mary's 35 th anniversary with her husband today , so she made his favor cookies! Yummmmmmmyyyyy! Mary came out and said hi and made sure everything was perfect, between cooking! Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Janice
Reviews.Content: Average French toast and good eggs and turkey bacon

Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: After seeing so many fellow Yeeps visit this little restaurant off Sahara and Decatur in the old Circuit City strip mall Cesar Q and I decided to follow suit.  Sadly I've driven past this place a million and one times and did not even know it was there.  So thank you, Yelp!  We were greeted at the door by a lovely and FRIENDLY woman from Columbia.  She handed us 2 menus and said to sit wherever we'd like.  Not sure about the negative reviews about this place saying they were rude. They were nothing but friendly with us.  We looked over the menu and when our waitress could see we were ready she returned.  I ordered the original style corned beef hash and eggs minus green pepper as I don't like green pepper aftertaste.  I had to order toast because I wanted to try the homemade jam/jellies!  So so glad I did!  We ordered our typical water with lemon then I remembered reading that the coffee is great at this place.  We waved our gal down and asked for coffee.  She asked if we wanted it regular or strong!? I order regular and it was great! All the hype is for real, yo!  Soon after she brought a tray by with a huge selection of bomb ass jams/jellies. We tried the mixed berry and the raspberry.  Both were great but the raspberry was awesome!!! The hash was really good but I did feel it  was a bit to greasy for my liking.  The potatoes were crispy and great.  The eggs were light and fluffy.    I'd say we will be back to try something else as the food was quality and the place comfortable.

Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: The food was good. I had the roast beef hash...had to try the hash you know. Place was clean, service a bit on the slow side, and our waitress was efficient and witty.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Had a great breakfast late on a Monday morning, mostly locals in there, good attentive servers, the jams and jellies were great, I had the meatloaf hash. My sister-in-law could have used some home-made salsa, but they don't have that, and other than that, we all enjoyed our late breakfast and coffees.

Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: Wanting to try somewhere new, my friend and I decided to give this place a try.  He had heard good things about this place.  We met here at noon on a Saturday for breakfast.   I was STARVING!  I checked out the menu online and it looked good.  We sat down and got our drink order immediately.  About five minutes later we got our order taken.  I decided try their Superhash on recommendation of the bus boy.   For two sides that are included, I chose the hash browns and cottage cheese.  My friend ordered the superhash as well with hash browns and fruit.  THIRTY minutes later, we finally get our food.  What the heck?  Other people were seated after us and got their food in less than FIVE minutes.  The food was disappointing.  The serving size was very small and miserable and our food was COLD!  Why oh why me?  I felt robbed having to pay for the food.  We left afterwards in search of a decent meal.  I wanted to like this place based on other yelpers' reviews, but I have to disagree with them on this one.  Poor service and food.  I'd rather skip a meal than eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Charlotte
Reviews.Content: Horrible, awful food!!!  Enough jalapenos in their chorizo to top an entire plate of nachos.  The eggs were well cooked but the chorizo was awful.  My husband had the mushy corned beef hash with eggs.  Not at all crispy.

Reviews.Author: Aimee
Reviews.Content: Who knows how to pack a punch ? Hash Hous- Ago-go does.   Definitely gets a WOW factor when you bring out of towners here.   The portions are ENORMOUS. We all thinking, more = bland. Not the case here at Hash House. It is delicious.   My favorite dish is the biscuits and gravy. Does not disappointment any time at all.   The serving size to price ratio is great.   I often go for their lemonade with a watermelon slice garnish.   Everything is good. Everything is worth the try.   Service is usually pretty good here, but please mind that since they are so loved by the community... there may be wait between service. It's not outrageous, so bring good company, good read and you're set to start you're day just right!

Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: It was inexpensive and good. Their juices come in a bottle so be ready for that, otherwise not bad. Not a smoke-filled atmosphere so that was nice. The waitress was the only one in the place, so she was swamped, but we didn't feel totally neglected. There was a little wait for the food and my 8 year old did ask for the TV to be turned on, and she said the boss didn't want it on, which was kind of odd. The jelly was so good. I got a jar of the mixed berry to take home.

Reviews.Author: Wes
Reviews.Content: I really liked our food here. I had the meatloaf hash, and while it was a bit sweet, there was nothing a little ketchup couldn't improve upon. The raspberry roll was also good, but way too sweet for my personal tastes. They also have a variety of jams which are on offer, I tried the passionfruit but was not a fan (again, too sweet).  Service was good, but at noon she got a little busy, and when I say  she  I mean the only waitress working the whole place. We had a good 20 minute wait for the food to come out, which wasn't awesome. Overall, though, I'd come back here. The food was good, and if you can stomach a potential wait you'll be pleased with what comes out of the kitchen.

Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: Beingfrom SoCal, we were all about the buffets. But we thought my wife and I would try something different. Thus, logged on Yelp and found this place. Ordered and loved the Party Hash. My wife had the strawberry waffles and loved it. I tried their homemade jellies. Our server recommended the jalapeño jelly. Wow, she didn't disappoint! We will definitely come back and start skipping the breakfast buffets before hitting the casino tables.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Mary's Hash House looks to have a fan base of regulars who stroll in the door every morning. They tend to sit in the main dining area, watch FOX News, and participate in friendly chit chat.  The food is hearty and the array of homemade jams are enticing. My experience was middle of the road. The Roasted Turkey and Avocado Omelet was fluffy and filled with chunks of white meat. Sandwiched in the fold was a white cheese. I am not sure what it was, probably Swiss because it was mild. Besides the two ingredients listed above, three slices of avocado adorned the top. Other than that, it was a bare of anything else. This observation is not a criticism. It is more of a complement, the omelet needed nothing else. Due to how juicy and well seasoned the poultry was the egg dish did not fall flat. All omelets and hash dishes come with two side dishes. Healthy options include cottage cheese and fruit. I got the grits and wheat toast. The former was magnificent with a little butter. The latter had way too much butter. I wish I knew so I could order it dry. The ample amounts of butter made the toast soggy. The two jams I tried were ok. The mixed berry was loose and runny. The sangria just does not translate well to jelly.  I sat in the quiet back room and dined alone. My choice to be by myself meant I didn't get checked up on and the check was dropped with my food.

Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  If I lived in Vegas still this would be my go to place for breakfast/brunch.  1st thing from what I can tell everything is pretty much made fresh.  I had the biscuits and gravy special.  The biscuit was so good and same thing with the Gravy.  A side of bacon and house fries... The other times I came here I had the western omelet.  My friend Vinny had the waffles and he said it was   Really good .    The location is on Decatur, and Sahara.  Its not a hole in the wall but it would be hard to spot off of the street.  Its in the closed down Circuit City center.  Mary herself has a very bubbly and interesting sense of humor.  The waitresses are pretty attentive and are always walking around passing out jelly samples for your toast.  I had strawberry and peach.  They even had jalapeño jelly...My friend vinny said it was good.  All in all I would definitely come here for breakfast.  Super good and fresh.  I always sat at the bar area around the TV but from what I can tell they are usually busy so get there early.

Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: Always yummy we love coming here to eat before we drive back to LA!   The turkey and avocado omelette with hash browns is soooo good!   Service here isn't  top notch  but it's super friendly :)

Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I love LOVE this place.  My last visit I tried some new jams...jalapeno jam and pineapple jam.  I told Mary I liked spicy, so she brought me ghost chili jam and habanero jam for my toast...amazing!  I was able to purchase a jar of the jam and bring it home to enjoy...how cool is that!? I even received a few tips on how to cook with it. This place always feels like having Sunday breakfast with your family.  Thank you for always maintaining a high level of customer service and superior dishes.

Reviews.Author: Darius
Reviews.Content: The food is good (check previous reviews), but my most recent visit was very bizarre.  I had the same server as I have the past 10 or so times I've been in here, an older woman.  There was one other customer in the restaurant and Fox News was on the TV going on about the Trayvon Martin case.    The server started talking to the customer about how casinos don't put up with people wearing hoodies, how there was a  weird Asian kid  who came in yesterday who wore a hoodie and baseball cap, and there's a reason so many black people are in jail.  Meanwhile I'm sitting like 10 feet away, wearing a hoodie and cap, and I'm half-black (very visibly not white).  What the hell?  I'll never be going back again, that's for sure.

Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Great place offering a delicious, hearty breakfast at a reasonable price.  And those fresh homemade jellies were amazing.  Plus, the staff was very pleasant, attentive and welcoming.  We felt like we were locals.  This is my favorite breakfast joint in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Cole
Reviews.Content: The meal I just ate was one of the best I have ever had. Their Cinnamon Roll French Toast is to die for... And everything else I had with the meal was good too. Old school feel with amazing food. YOU HAVE TO GO TO THIS PLACE

Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: Feel like I'm at home here. Love the service and the food is great. Breakfast is always great especially all the different hash options and fresh jams. I had a Reuben today and saved half of it for dinner. Portions size excellent

Reviews.Author: Sonia
Reviews.Content: I searched one $ cheap breakfast, looking for a place to sit and relax before a meeting. The Hash House popped up as a mile away so I decided to give it a try. Coffee and corned beef hash was $12.70. Service was great- I never had an empty cup. The food however was lackluster. I found myself adding all four of their in-house seasonings to try and bring up the flavor level. As far as I could tell, the ingredients were fresh and cooked perfectly; they just lacked seasoning.  The menu is well rounded- with breakfast and lunch items. I will probably try one more time to see if it was just the corned beef hash.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Another great find on Yelp!! I would have never know this place existed. I have eaten here twice and it has been consistently good. This is a real Hash House with several different kinds of hash!! Omelets, pancakes, waffles oh and did I almost forget the JELLY, they make about 20 different flavors and you can try as many as you want with your breakfast!! Would have been 5 stars but the biscuits and gravy could use a little work.

Reviews.Author: Sonia Mae
Reviews.Content: I would've given 5 stars, but my waitress lead me astray. First, let me start by saying that this will not be my typical, critical review but hey I am a critical person (that's why i Yelp for Help, lol).   Anyhow, at first I was stuck between the choice of the salmon hash and the lobster and spinach omelet. I asked the waitress which one was better and she told me that she prefers the hash. Maybe, i shoulda went with my gut (especially because I was starving), but i heeded her advice and was severely disappointed. My salmon hash was chunks of salmon fillet spread over home fries. Maybe I was expecting something different but I was not too happy with the meal.  After notifying the waitress, i switched to the lobster and spinach omelet, which was like a party in my belly! It was delicious!!! I enjoyed my meal and would def return, but next time im not asking for advice!

Reviews.Author: Elia
Reviews.Content: This  hole in the wall  restaurant was a pleasant surprise.  You'll see a sign that reads,  Seat Yourself  the moment you walk in.  The restaurant tables were all occupied so I marched my little legs over to the bar where there was open seating!  Mary, the owner, immediately approached me after I sat down and wiped down the counter.  Very friendly woman!    There are two options for coffee, medium roast and bold roast.  I couldn't help myself when it came to the refills and ended up downing 3 mugs worth!  Tried both brews and both hit the spot.  A variety of creamers are provided like french vanilla, hazelnut, and irish cream to name a few.  My brother and I split 3 dishes.  The Party Hash consisted of a nice variety of flavors.  The mixture of chicken, corned beef, ham and roast beef all worked well with the mixed veggies.  Some of the jalapeño slices had a real kick!  Fresh jalapeños are used so be warned if your tolerance for spicy food is low!  (4 stars)  The Corned Beef Hash was lacking in the meat department.  Not sure if this was an isolated incident or if that's normal, but the meat was definitely seasoned/cooked nicely!  This comes with your choice of eggs and I went with sunny side up!  Overall, not bad. (3.5 stars)  The Monte Cristo was my favorite dish above all!  The thin sliced ham and turkey is nice and juicy!  Gooey Swiss cheese... that speaks for itself.  This is served inside some sweet homemade bread (mmm... the hint of vanilla) which was fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside!  For any first timers out there, picture French Toast meets Grilled Cheese.  You can approach this beast in 2 ways.  The first way would be to drizzle syrup on top and attack it with a fork/knife.  The second way would be to grab a slice with your hand and dip it into the syrup.  Call me a savage, but the second way should be the only option allowed. (5 stars)  Both plates of hash came with a choice of sides:  Fresh Fruit - I chuckled when I was brought out strawberries and bananas.  Not what I expected when I placed my order, but no complaints here.  Wheat Toast - The homemade bread was delicious!  This was purposely ordered as an excuse to try out the homemade jelly!  Tried the pumpkin and jalapeño which were both fantastic!  So fantastic that I actually bought a jar of both flavors (yes it's made and sold there)!  Homefries - This side was recommended by the server.  I was expecting french fries, so I was slightly disappointed... wish the server or the menu had provided a description.  My best attempt at describing this dish would be  steamed potato meets hash brown.   Hopefully the picture provided along with this review will help that description.  They were good, but nothing special.  This was my first, but definitely not my last visit.  The staff was very attentive and kind.    P.S. Be warned that the wait time for food is a little on the long side!

Reviews.Author: Carri
Reviews.Content: I came for their strawberry waffle, with this high hope for a fresh strawberry, homemade whipped cream, wonderful homemade strawberry jam/syrup, sweet waffley-greatness.  The waffle was plain in taste, along with the strawberry   sauce  was nothing but that nasty thick red compote. On top of it was $10 HAHA.   So if I ever try this place again it'd be for their homemade hash that people are raving about. Hopefully all their tlc is in that.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Very tasty food, very affordable. Amazing jams, amazing chicken fried steak. Super tasty toast, crunchy bacon. Wheelchair and children friendly.  Heads up! It's worth noting that if you have any special eating accommodations, ask in detail and clarify first. In our  scenario,  real  maple syrup is required for my waffles, and they said they said they had it. But, it was maple flavored corn syrup. The chef came out and gave us another, different meal fortunately.   In summary: very tasty, affordable, great volume, staff are good. If you're super picky, be very specific. This is not a casino restaurant - it's a homey tasty niche in Vegas! Come with homey tasty expectations :)

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING!  I'm sooooo glad I found this spot! Best breakfast / lunch in Vegas! Charming spot with a great staff! Mary is so sweet! She's created a wonderful dining experience.  I had the pleasure to share with her how I found her spot, (on YELP) and how much I enjoyed her food.  She is so humble and has a wonderful story as to how she developed her culinary talents.  Great lady!  We loved it soooooo much, we came here for breakfast two days in a row...  Haha Try the chicken and waffles with grits! Really really good! Oh, the spicy chicken soup is AMAZING!

Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This looks like a small  mom and pop shop  that has a good feel but u Soon realize the lack of concern they have for their customers... No room to support a Sunday morning rush... Let's talk about the service... Let's just say the check came faster than the food did--literally waited for two hours. Also, who serves canned soda...?  Mom and Pop  capability but a  hole-in-the-wall  reality...

Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: This is the best breakfast/ brunch place in Vegas and if you're in town anywhere near hear you have to give this place or forever feel that you have missed the best chance for the best homemade jellies and everything here is homemade so give this place a chance. If you come here you will figure it out   why I come all the way here from downtown Henderson.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: First timer to Mary's Hash House. Her homemade hash terrific, hand made preserves and jams awesome and service great. Her hand made cinnamon rolls to die for. Skip the strip and eat there!

Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are real breakfast people.  So we tried Mary's and the food was great.  Pouched eggs with biscuits/gravy and the party hash did not disappoint.  The fruit was fresh the coffee was strong and the jelly were jammin.  Our waitress at first seemed rough and unfriendly but once you started talking to her she was nice.  We talked about good food places to go for bbq because she from Texas.  Overall we will be back.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: All I can say about Mary's Hash House is  A go go  somewhere, anywhere else. The wife and I stopped by, and the place was busy. After reading all the awesome reviews here, we were excited to try it....  And after trying it, I started looking for Gordon Ramsay or Robert Irvine to see if they were there trying to save the place.....  We sat ourselves, and within a minute or two, one of the bus boys came over to get our drink order, and he only made one mistake, so, forgivable. We waited about 15 minutes before our server stopped by to tell us she would be there in a few minutes......Ten minutes later she showed up. (unforgivable)  She took our order, we ordered the roast beef hash and the corned beef hash. One with home fries, the other with hash-browns. The order came with two eggs each. My wife ordered over easy, and I ordered over medium. Hers eggs were perfect, mine, the yolks were nearly hard.  Now let's talk about the potatoes, her hash-browns were not seasoned, were barely cooked, and were very greasy. My home-fries, were abysmal. They were still raw in places, and again, zero seasoning, and lots o grease.  Hash...the raison d'etre for this place...I have one word, disgusting. The roast beef....more like where's the beef? It looked and tasted like overcooked ground beef, not even the good stuff, no flavor other than grease, and again, I point out, over cooked.Where is the seasoning?  The Corned beef, people from the emerald isle would weep over how bad this was. It was DRIED OUT, and it looked and tasted like it was the last of what was left that was scraped together and dumped on a plate. No seasoning, and there was almost no meat in it at all.  At this point, our waitress came back and asked us how everything was and my wife told her it was horrible. Giving credit where credit is due, she did offer us the change to replace the food with something else. Here is where my wife once again proved she is smarter than I, she said no. I ordered a cheese burger. After the debacle with the hash-browns and home-fries, I declined french fries and asked for coleslaw.  About 15 minutes later, my burger arrived. It was cooked as ordered, but there is where the positivism ends. There was ZERO flavor or seasoning on the burger, and it was greasy as hell.The coleslaw was so sweet, I could only eat one bite.  After all was said and done, the only thing they charged me for was the burger and two cups of coffee. So I do give them credit for that, but the food was lousy and we won't be back.  Note: I did not mention the side of fruit my wife ordered that came with bruised strawberries.... Note II: When we arrived and we were waiting for our food, we noticed a lot of people leaving a lot of food behind, before trying to eat, we thought it was because of portion sizes, nope...Portion sizes are ok, food is just bad.

Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Service was a little slow. Sat there about 8 minutes before they asked what we wanted to drink. After that though, it flew! Food was ready quickly and came out pipping hot.  The Sage Chicken and Waffles were worth the trip from the Strip. Wife and MIL shared a hash skillet that they oo'd and ahh'd over. The kid ate a chocolate-chip pancake and smiled the whole time.  Pricey, but delicious.

Reviews.Author: Barbie
Reviews.Content: A hash house that specializes in hash. Who knew?! The hash is amazing here. They were offering a special duck hash and lobster hash the morning I went. I ordered the Classic hash. It was AMAZING. Next time I'll try something different, now that I know it's good.   PROS: Classic Hash             Cinnamon Bread French Toast

Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Just visited this place for the first time from out of state based on Yelp feedback.  It is in a nice area and restaurant is clean and appealing.    Food was reasonable and tastey.  I had traditional corned beef hash and it was very good.  My son had turkey hash and it was dry.  You have to get cinnamon rolls or raspberry ones if they are hot and fresh.  Reason I didn't give 5 stars was service was horribly slow,  waitress never brought my daughters hash browns,  waitress was personable nor suggestive.   To get 5 stars it has to be complete package.

Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to eat breakfast when we are in Las Vegas. Hard to beat fresh out of the oven cinnamon rolls. Homemade corn beef is amazing. Everybody is very nice.

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: While there's no super innovative fusion dishes everything was made/executed with  love .  Proper crunch/golden-brown crisped edges on home fries with seemingly freshly chopped veggies (ie not pre-processed in some faraway Sysco factory).  Properly cooked/crispy bacon chunks topped my Mary's Bendict along with soft (again) well-executed poached eggs and (yes, again) seemingly in-house made gravy.  Friends' omelettes and hashes were all super-well received.  Fruit (bananas and strawberries) was even seemingly fresh cut.  Service was great.  Perfect getaway from the sometimes zombie/mass-prepared food of the Strip.  Driving through/around Asia-town also allows for banh-mi or dumplings pick up.

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing to write home about.  Hidden away in a corner of the shopping mall near Decatur and Sahara, one would almost miss it if they weren't already trying to track it down.  As the restaurant is only open till 2pm, if you take too long to find it, you won't make it in time.  When we entered the restaurant, we found our table and the waitress dropped off the menu's without asking us if we'd like something to drink.  This would be understandable if it was slammed in the restaurant.  We were one of two or three tables occupied, however, so this with the fact that it took her another 10-15 minutes to return diminished our hopes of an enjoyable meal.  I am one to believe that a restaurant should not be entirely judged on one particular meal alone.  Much like Lotus of Siam, where it is said the Northern Menu is what the restaurant is best known for, the Hash here is supposed to be excellent.  I, however, am not a big fan of hash so I chose to not eat it (as well it was lunch).  The food that we did order (the Peasant Lunch was my choice) was decent but again, a bowl of chili, plain toast and a small cup of strawberries and banana's did not seem to be worth $6.99.  Between the two Hash House moniker's, I would recommend A-Go-Go.  Forget about the looks of either place...at A-Go-Go, the food is better all around (I don't have to limit myself to one particular type of food) and the portions are huge.  If I want a small, decently cooked home-made meal, I'll go to the 50's Diner on Jones near the 215 or Black Bear Diner on Jones and Tropicana.  Both are much more appropriate choices with better service and decent food.

Reviews.Author: Rakiesha
Reviews.Content: We saw this place on Food Network's Chopped and had to check it out. First time we went, I had the corned beef hash. Oh my goodness. I'll never be able to eat the canned stuff again. I was quite yummy, and there was so much of it!  The second time, I had the waffle. Was definitely not disappointed. I also tried one of their homemade jellies. Will definitely be ordering some off their website for the holidays.  The chef, Mary, even came out to talk with us. Very nice little local place to hit up when you want a break from the Strip and the insane food prices.

Reviews.Author: Alison
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING including the grits (I'm very picky when it comes to grits) was delish!!! This will be in our regular rotation!!!

Reviews.Author: Jaimz
Reviews.Content: Hands down, and I mean that, hands down the best breakfast in town. I love the cozy, miss matched decor and friendly vibe. It feels like you are eating a home cooked meal at a friend's house. The food, particularly the corned beef hash and the monte cristo sandwich, are fantastic. Truth be told, I'm a regular. I've becoming here for roughly 10 years. The food has never suffered once and the prices have remained affordable. Mary, the owner, is usually around ensuring everyone is enjoying their meal. Which is something you just don't see too often anymore. Love this place.

Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: The food was good. Corned beef hash was great! Hash Browns should have been crisp,they were not. Jam was great. Service was worst ever. Waitress had no personality and no service. No refill on coffee, but she made sure she got a tip I paid the bill. WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!!

Reviews.Author: Lucy
Reviews.Content: When Friend #1 said he usually goes to Denny's for breakfast when he's in Vegas, I knew I had to lead us all into the light!  Parking was easy and free in the strip mall lot, and we seated ourselves when we walked in.  We were greeted with menus by our friendly server and coffee (regular or bold!), decaf and waters came out fast.   Our food landed in front of us within 10 minutes of ordering - yay!  Me: Angus Top Sirloin & Eggs ($10.95) - served with cottage cheese and an english muffin (my choice of 2 sides), my steak was perfectly rare next to the scrambled eggs.  This is what I needed!  Friend #1: Corned Beef Hash ($7.95) - served w/hash browns and an english muffin, this potatoey, oniony hash had crispy bits of meat in it.  It was not as meaty as we expected - they could stand to bump up the ratio of meat to potatoes & onions.  Biscuits & Gravy ($7.25) - served w/2 eggs and nicely crisped bacon, these b&gs were yummy!  Still crispy edged yet fluffy under the gravy.  To share: Blueberry Pancakes, short stack ($3.50) - super blueberry-y, not overly sweet, really good!  After the food came out, our efficient server brought a tray of house made jams and jellies for us.  They sparkled like multi-colored gems!  We tried:  Apple Butter - super cinnamony, we all wanted to eat this with a spoon  Pineapple Jam - sticky and chunky, like pie filling, this was tasty but overly sweet.  We loved the casual diner atmosphere, and the food and service made us happy. So yes I'm a fan!

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: If I could give this place 2 1/2 stars, I would. The food itself is actually quite good. I had a ham steak with eggs, home fries and grits. The grits weren't good, but everything else was pretty tasty. The portions were pretty good for being around $10. Other people in my party ordered pancakes which were pretty good despite not coming with any other sides.   The reason this place received the rating it did is because the service that we received was just terrible. For the place being half full, we expected our food to be ready within 10-12 minutes, which is standard for the industry. Really, cooking the food we ordered shouldn't have taken more than 5-7 minutes, but we did not receive our food until 35 minutes after we placed our order. Our water glasses were never refilled and our waitress never checked up on us while we were waiting for our food.   Overall, it was a disappointing experience. Hoping to find a better breakfast place off the strip next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: This place is AWFUL!!!  If you're looking for a good/great breakfast, go to Mr. Mamas or Babystacks.  We went on the recommendation of a local hairstylist.  There is only ONE waitress working the entire restaurant  (never seen that before) and her customer service is terrible.  The only good thing that came out of here is the toast and jam.  Save your appetite and money to be used at a better place to eat.  You have been warned.

Reviews.Author: Callie
Reviews.Content: Seriously awesome food. Really slow service- but well worth the wait. Best biscuits and gravy I've ever had in a restaurant. Homemade jams and jellies. Yum!

Reviews.Author: Joani
Reviews.Content: The service, coffee, eggs, and bacon were very good.  However, the biscuits were small, over done and the sausage gravy was watery and kind of tasteless.  I would come back, I just wouldn't have the biscuits and gravy.

Reviews.Author: Kristin
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Hash House before and LOVED it. The food is soooo good but sadly this time I am only giving it 2 stars, and they are lucky to get those. We came in on Sunday 8/17 around 11:30am. It was past the breakfast rush and before the lunch rush. I don't know if it was just our server but my goodness the service was TERRIBLE. We seated ourselves as the sign requests. There were MANY empty tables yet the first thing our server told us was how busy it was. We looked around very confused, but whatever maybe they were short staffed. NOPE I counted three servers in a very small restaurant should be plenty.    It took us about 10 mins just to get coffee, which we desperately needed. Once we got the coffee I had to wait another 5 mins for the milk for the coffee. I finally gave up and went to the counter to get the milk. My server appeared to have forgotten. Since we knew this was already off to a bad start we all figured out what we wanted quickly and ordered as soon as we could get our servers attention.   Getting a refill on coffee was literally like pulling teeth. We noticed the two (yes only two) other tables that were occupied commenting on how long it was taking, that they were just going to leave and so on. We were hungry so we stayed. After waiting a significant time one of my friends asked our server if our food would be out soon. Honest to goodness she looked like she either didn't know what we were talking about or was put off by us asking. She replied,  Oh, I don't know. I will go see.  I am sorry...what?????  After she  went to go see  our food was brought out not 5 mins later. It wasn't super hot so maybe it had been sitting there...I don't know. Anyways, the food was just as good as I remembered. The jams are sooo good. The apple and raspberry jams are amazing. I am super bummed to give the Hash House a bad review, but dang that service was NO GOOD. Get it together guys, great food is well...great, but terrible service can kill a restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Cassie
Reviews.Content: What a funny little find in Vegas. We decided to forego much of the standard  Vegas  experience in favor of a look into the real Vegas, where the locals go for good food.  We stumbled across this place and I'm so glad we did. The strip mall location and decor aren't anything to write home about, but I had a killer omelet and some MUCH needed strong dark roast coffee. I love that they give you the option of regular and STRONG coffee, and it's not the usual swill you get at most diners.   I'll be back on my next Vegas trip, this is a great find.

Reviews.Author: Khanh
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, wanted to go to  A GO GO  but mistakingly ended up here, there even was a sign on the place  saying it was recently filmed on some show , I wanted to try  Hash House A GO GO  because I saw it on Dives, Diners, etc... anywho, the place wasnt too bad but for what you get, it's is mediocre.. kinda on the expensive side. the only positive is they have a few different flavors of Ketchup and sauces which helps spice up the flavor.. other than that.. Dennys is more the theme

Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: This place is delicious. Seriously, all comfort foods but not heavy and overly sugared or creamed. They work magic with their eggs, make sure you ask for scrambled with cheese. They have these home made cinnamon rolls that make you come back for more every time. Make sure you try the strawberry habanero jelly! Perfectly sweet with just the right amount of spice. All the waitresses are adorable, and probably the most friendly people I've ever met. I love coming here (:

Reviews.Author: Darcy
Reviews.Content: Great home style breakfast.  Nothing fancy.  I had chicken and waffles.  Husband had griddle cakes,  sausage,  biscuits and gravy.

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Waited 10 minutes, we had to call the waitress over ourselves. just to have the waitress tell us she would come right back so we asked for water because we had already been waiting 10 minutes. And 10 minutes later and the waitress never bought out our water so we left. AWFUL SERVICE

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Very underwhelmed with this place.  A pretty run down strip mall with decent parking.  Lots of empty tables at 10am on a Friday.  Our party of 8 was kind of overwhelming for the one server.  Service was lackadaisical but decent if not on the slow side.  They are known for their hash and most of us were pleased.  Great OJ but terrible fruit.  Not worth a long drive.  Decent if you are within a mile.

Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: i've tried this place 3 times - i want to like this place, no, actually, i want to luv this place - like the maple tree, jamm's, Lou's, etc, i have a soft spot in my heart for local diner/breakfast spots and i want them to not only succeed but to have GREAT FOOD.  Big surprise, the hash house specialty - HASH.  They also have homemade breads and jellies.  I get the combo hash ( several meats mixed together ) and some rye bread.  The rye bread is good, the jelly - eh, ok but honestly,  ain't big on jellies to begin with - i prefer the bread for sopping up the tidbits.  the hash - boring for me - the portions are very  controlled  a definite no-no for me at a diner type place.   the cost - damn i forget - definitely under $10 including the coffee.  Overall, the food is ok but give me maple tree, black bear, jamms and if hash is your thing, i think a go-go is much more creative.

Reviews.Author: Kirstie
Reviews.Content: Yelp 100 Challenge * 82/100  Imagine entering your adorable grandma's kitchen; drapes on the windows, old pictures hung on the walls, homemade jams and sauces, fresh cut fruits, television in the background. It's definitely a cute place to start off the day with family but first, make sure you find it.   Hash House lies along Decatur (cross street Sahara), just a couple of shops away from Aloha kitchen. It took my mom and me some time to find. Take note, if you're taking Sahara from the West, be sure to turn right before you hit Decatur.   When we got there, Mary had us pick our own seats since there weren't a lot of customers. We ordered the Super Hash (ham, roast beef, poached chicken etc) with hash browns, 2 eggs and 2 whole wheat bread. Hash House's homemade ketchup was a nice added touch and their selection of jams was quite a variety! Breakfast was decent but not special otherwise.   My mom and I love to experiment with new recipes every so often and ladies, what they have on their menu is not something you can't put together. I applaud the staff for keeping the restaurant in check and orderly, but I also believe that a restaurant should deserve more recognition if it offers something new, unique and exotic. This place may be a nice change from Denny's or IHOP although it's not one to repeat a lot.

Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: Waited about 10 minutes to be asked about our drinks. My sister got an iced coffee and she said it tasted like the jack in the box syrup coffee. Was never asked about refills or if she wanted water also. The server was the only one for the whole restaurant. We ordered and then waited another 30 minutes for the food. In the mean time she was walking around little ramekins of jelly because there wasn't any on the tables. We weren't asked about refills or wanting anything else in the mean time. I ordered a Belgian waffle that came out cold and hard. The batter used for the waffle was plain and flavorless. My sister ordered French toast, sticky bun style. It was also cold and hard. Tasted more like a cinnamon roll than French toast. Hash browns were very plain and nothing special. We chose this place because we wanted to get off the strip for breakfast food. Now I'm hungry and disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Chilly
Reviews.Content: Monte cristo!!! Best I've ever had and great down to  earth service! Best jam as well! Loved it

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for some CBH, this is the spot!  Right down the street from the HHAGG, this hidden gem is tucked away in a strip mall at Decatur and Sahara.  This place is a small slice of Americana and the owner, Mary (featured on FoodNetwork's Chopped) is awesome!   A must try if you have the chance for multiple trips is the Party Hash. Also, check out the homemade jams.  Be warned that the food doesn't always come out as quick as some people would like it, but it is well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite places to go. It's not on the menu but the Lobster Benedict is one of the best and there's something about their white, buttered toast and home made jams that are heavenly. Love this place.

Reviews.Author: Colleen
Reviews.Content: The corned beef hash was the best I've had! The service was excellent. We will definitely be back the next trip in town!

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: We went here because of Yelp's 4 of 5 stars. It did not disappoint. If you want fancy smancy and portions that are too much for a healthy lifestyle keep on going. If you want a hot breakfast with killer choices of jam and tasty hash plates then this is your place. Our service time was average and our waitress guided us since we were 1st timers. My wife got biscuits and gravy with eggs and I tried the traditional hash. Her biscuits were a tad overdone but that would be the only negative. Also get yourself a cinnamon roll and try the jalapeno jam on your toast.  We will put Mary's Hash House into our rotation.

Reviews.Author: Chermaine
Reviews.Content: Great place to eat .. Hidden Gem!! We will be back for sure :) Homemade Jam and Jelly is spectacular!!

Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: Service can make or break a place, and my experience here was lack there of. From the moment I entered, I waited a few minutes to be told ,  can't you read seat your self. I sat myself and the older lady waitress with dark hair plopped down the menu on my table. Really??? Walked away and came back she said  so u ready to order  placed my order , only waited a few minutes for my monte cristo to arrive , she served it and walked away, no conversation at all. I could only eat half so after sitting for 5 minutes while she placed silverware on the other tables she glanced at me rolled her eyes and went back into the kitchen. 5-10 minutes pass as I'm just sitting there starring at the walls thinking any minute now she will offer me a box. Nope , didn't  happen she came back still nothing. I said can I please have a box and my check, very politely and she sighed, plopped my box and the check. Really!!!? Not once did she ask me how was everything or if i needed anything. There was no service. It made me feel like why did I even come here ! Not once did I complain or was I a hard time. I really don't get how severs who don't give a little service have jobs. Now the reason I didn't give 1 star only was the food was pretty good 3-4 stars for tasty food. 0 for not having human decency in service!

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: FAVORITE: Corned Beef Hash w/ over medium eggs w/ hasbrowns slathered w/ HABANERO KETCHUP   ok so i dont want to look like a pig so this is usually breakfast and tomorrows lunch or something, but this place is amazing...  our friend introduced us to this place a while back and we have craved ever since, we always try to make it a point to stop here whenever we are in town. My boyfriend and i LOVE IT!!!   the habanero ketchup is to die for it gives everything that great kick and the corned beef has isn't like any other. I went to original pancake house and got the corned beef has there but it was served like in a patty?!?   this place is a cute family owned place and their service isn't bad for one waitress and one busboy. They are relatively attentive considering both times i've been there hasn't been a wait.   okay so this review may be all over the place, but i just can't express how great i think this place is!!!!

Reviews.Author: Vickie
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended Hash House. I only realized it was the other Hash House afterwards.   This place isn't bad, but nothing spectacular. I came here with the expectation that this place had enormous portions. When the food came, I was a bit disappointed in the size.   The food itself is not bad. I got the CHICKEN HASH and it was pretty good. It came with two eggs and I got to choose two sides. I got the toast and fresh fruit with it. The fruit was strawberries and bananas.   They have a variety of homemade jams and jellys. I tried the watermelon, apple jalepeno and peach. The peach jam was delicious!! There were real chunks of fresh fruit in there. The watermelon was a bit too sweet, tasted like a watermelon  jolly rancher. The apple jalepeno was interesting, but it was good. There wasn't much spice to it, but it was balanced pretty well.   Service was good. A lot of locals come here, and the servers all knew them well. Overall, this place is a decent breakfast place.

Reviews.Author: Caitlin
Reviews.Content: Don't do it. I know, I know- the chef has been on Chopped. That's awesome, but the restaurant is not. The jelly selection is impressive (if not a little overwhelming), but the food is just...no. I ordered the corned beef hash and it had no flavor. I expected more than what looked like canned hash and tasted even worse. Could have been an off day, but I generally give places two tries because everyone can have a bad day; unfortunately for this establishment though, I'm not feeling that generous.

Reviews.Author: Blanca
Reviews.Content: One of the earliest restaurants that serves good breakfast omelet Creamy Potato is also good, the creamyness of the potato is there's no doubt that its has top quality taste recommended for breakfast meals, specially if you have earlier shifts oh and the ambiance, it feels like home, so good.

Reviews.Author: Eve
Reviews.Content: Go here.  Food is dynamite.  The hashes, the biscuits, the housemade sausage--all incredible.  Oh, and the cinnamon rolls.  Plus, a huge variety of homemade jellies.  Went here twice during a 4 day trip to Vegas.  Delicious.

Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: The food was good, and the jams as stated by others were great.  Service however was slow and the restaurant had a dated feel.  We waited roughly 10 minutes before our food and drink orders were taken.  I never had and offer or opportunity to ask for a refill of my coffee.  Additionally, when I went to the register to pay, another waitress looked at me, then walked off.  I waited another 5 minutes to pay with our waitress.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: GREAT breakfast at Mary's Hash House...delicious and interesting variety of hash...homemade jams and jellies...quick and courteous service, great coffee...if you're off the strip and looking for the mom-and-pop experience, try this place...

Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and sat in the parking lot for 15 minutes debating. I really wanted a waffle, thinking I would just be smart and order extra syrup, I could flag someone down for coffee, so I went in.  I found a seat by the window, there were TWO other tables seated. The great haired (uh oh) waitress came over and Hi. I ordered a waffle, and coffee, she asked strong and I said strong. Ordered extra butter, syrup, creamer.  She left and an older couple sat themselves, then 5 people came in and went to the back. My waffle arrived.... Wait, what? Less than five min? As she sat it down she said, and I quote  I thought I'd get it to you before I lose it. I HATE BIG GROUPS.  Um... Sorry? She then told the older couple all about it, all about it. In detail.   I couldn't get more coffee, because after a pass through early on the owner was in back. No other people.  I are my Uneventful Waffle with Amazingly Taste Free Syrup, and she brought the bill. They stand there, with a little machine they hand you, and stare as you put the tip amount in. Then give you the receipt. I'm pretty sure of myself most times but it was creepy.  The parking lot was really big. I guess that brings it up to two stars.

Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: Horrendous. First time for both my friend and I. We had high hopes, had heard good things even from my non-yelp friends. Wasn't expecting a mid west style diner, when we walked in, the first thing I noticed was a giant big screen tv hanging over the bar replaying CNN or Fox (I can't even remember what it was, as I can't stand watching either) and a couple old dudes hanging around watching it. We seat ourselves, and we are roughly  greeted  by a woman and before I can finish my sentence of ordering coffee, she has already left our table. We noticed right away she was the only one serving the entire restaurant. So she comes back to finish our order, and before two words can get out of my mouth, she leaves to go answer the telephone.   We finally place our order, San Diego Omelet with a side of grits and Monte Cristo with Sweet Potato fries. They both come out, they look decent, but one bite into the Monte Cristo and I was done, it was disgusting. Inedible and I don't know how but my fries were sour. I never leave a fry untouched. Never. I couldn't eat them. The San Diego Omelet was nothing special. The only thing this place has going for them is they don't use instant grits.

Reviews.Author: Arthur
Reviews.Content: **Summary**        - Homemade Jams - After you order, they bring a tray over with homemade jams inside jello shot cups. We each got two. From strawberry to pineapple to even jalapeno, these jams add a personal touch to your meal. They also sell the jams too.        - Decor - The place is a mom and pop brunch place. You get what you get. **Ordered**        - $8.95 Party Hash - Corn beef, ham, roasted, beef, chicken in a hash. I had to get a hash since the place is called Hash House, but it wasn't anything special.        - $8.50 Tuna Melt - Probably one of the best tuna melts I've had. The cheese was perfectly melted and the bread was amply buttered. I'm talking AMPLY. I wouldn't be surprised if Paula Deen were in the back. **Recommendations**        - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a nice brunch place with a small town feel.

Reviews.Author: Sophia
Reviews.Content: ...                     . ,  -  -- -     ,.       . . .       , '         _  _         ',             _   | | |     j       /  '          `  \       t        f   |   t   j     f      |                   |     j        t   |    T       j        \               /       t        Y |     |          ',       `  -     -'       ,'           |  |    U             '   ~  -  -  ~  '                LJ   Do you know a place where you can get a home-made hash, served with a home-made spicy ketchup or a home-made habanero sauce, or a home-made chipotle sauce; served with toast, served with a choice of at least 20 home-made jams, with flavors like watermelon, habanero, apple, strawberry, jalapeno, peach?  Well, now you do - it's Hash House (not to ever be confused with the Hash House A-Go-Go chain) To see it is to believe it - so check out the photos link above.  'nuff said.   Must haves:  Super Hash Monte Cristo  Meatloaf  Stuffed french toast (4 pieces) with cream cheese and topped with fresh made berry compote.

Reviews.Author: MIKE
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place rocks! The service, the food, the wonderful home made deserts and jams. I've never been here and I live in San Diego. I'll come here any time I'm in town. The owner was beyond sweet and gave my buddy and I great big to go cups of coffee which was another wow! I've been running F&B almost 20 years and she's doing a excellent job. Keep  Mom and Pop  alive and we will see you very soon. Thanks again.

Reviews.Author: Judye
Reviews.Content: We ate here on a Thursday afternoon.  The restaurant had just a couple of other patrons but the service was super slow.  We had to grab a busser, it seems, to take our order.  My husband ordered the sage chicken.  It was enormous.  The presentation was quite impressive. The flavor was pretty good, too.    Our orders, however, didn't arrive simultaneously.  I hate that.  Would you believe I didn't receive my Caesar salad until 10 minutes after my husband's order arrived  Very irritated.  The servers were friendly but they never checked on us either.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I love this place! We've been coming to Mary's since before she moved to this location. We followed her here, we love it so much.   When I was on Weight Watchers, there were lots of options that are standard on the menu for light eating. But don't get me wrong, this place has some extremely satisfying home cooked meals, too!

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: If you're in Vegas visiting from Manitoba or Michigan, this probably isn't the Hash House you're looking for.  Hash House a Go Go is another 2 miles up on Sahara, turn right when you start getting the smell of wasted food and rosemary branches from the ridiculously large servings they shovel at you there.  With that out of the way, this place is great.  I'm here almost every Sunday for breakfast.  This is the kind of place I would want to hang out if I lived in a small town.  It's almost out of place in the strip mall, and would seem a lot more at home on Main Street in some city famous for the world's largest collection of rubber bands, or the track team winning the class AA title for the last 4 years running.  None of the glasses, coffee mugs, forks, knives, plates...anything matches.  You can tell it's all a mishmash group of utensils and china that has been picked up when prices are good.  I think it's great.  The food is outstanding.  It's hard to decide many Sundays what the best thing to get is.  I usually stick with the Party Hash, which is a mix of the Corned Beef/Turkey/Roast Beef/something else Hash.  It's by far the best hash I've ever had.  I've been eating it on a regular basis for six years.  When I'm up for something different, the triple decker sandwiches never disappoint.    I won't go line by line of the menu, I'll just say.  I've been coming here forever and have never left disappointed.  Two of my favorites that would suggest to all first timers.  #1: The Sausage Patty.  The Homemade sausage is perfect.  For people like myself that don't enjoy sweets and would much rather follow up a steak dinner with another steak than a piece of chocolate cake, this is as close to heaven as you get.  Even if you just like sausage a little bit, get the sausage.  #2: Homemade Jelly.  She always does something special, but my favorite has been the Sangria Jelly.  At the same time she did Sangria there was a Tequila Sunrise Jelly as well.  Both were awesome, both will be missed.  The basics are always awesome as well, Strawberry is my go to jelly.  I would probably inject it into my vein, given the chance.  Get toast, just to try the jelly.  Short story:  This place is great.  The service is what I would expect out of a diner-like establishment.  Sometimes is gets a little busy with theafter church/baseball tournament crowd.  However, Darlene is always great, and always fun to talk to.  Same with Mary, the owner, always friendly and available to help.  If you're hungry for great breakfast and have an extra $10/head make the trip to the corner of Sahara and Decatur.  You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Not to be confused with  Hash House A-Go-Go.  The Hash House is that typical off the strip Vegas dilemma. The restaurant is an unsuspecting caught in the middle of a strip mall location.   The service is great, friendly and fast as I think the people who work there own it. The decor is almost random I guess this is some sort of Midwest motif? Even the plates don't match the cups and that's cool.  The bottom line is the food is so good. As the name indicates it's all about their Hash. Before this visit I wasn't aware of how many varieties of hash there are. The Hash is the specialty and it's authentic. Not like the stuff I'm used to- from the can.  The Ingredients are super fresh and you get the sense that it's made from scratch per your order. This goes for everything from the coffee to the bacon as well.   Don't sleep on this place, because it closes at 2:00 PM... Get it don't sleep...Breakfast... Don't sleep, Um? Forget it... Hash House will be one of your favorite Breakfast spots.

Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: Food is okay. Service is pretty terrible. Took the server about 10 minutes even take our order and then took about 30-40 minutes for our food to arrive. They only had two servers and two cooks with a full house. Water cup stayed empty the whole time and finally got the side of ranch that we asked for twice after 3/4 of the meal was already finished. The special spicy ketchup was pretty gross. It was really sweet and definitely not what my taste buds were expecting. The steak was overcooked. They have a variety of jams and jellies, which I thought was cool. That may have been the only thing I really liked about here. I would bump this place up to 4 stars if it wasn't for the really slow service. Perhaps I was just extra impatient that day considering I was hungover and needed food pronto.

Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: All I can say is Mary's hash house is not just a a place for great food that won't leave you feeling heavy after breakfast. It's a dinner with that old American Midwest flavor. From the friendly personal service(Mary usually comes out and greets her guests.) To the random coffee mugs, the home made bread and the jams all made in house that make you feel at home. I've been going to Mary's for a long time and anyone I take with me just loves it. Highly recommended. In my opinion. It's the best breakfast in Las Vegas. Kudos to Mary for keeping it simple and keeping it fresh.

Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: This place probably gets mistaken for the Hash House A Go Go a lot.  However, when we called to make reservations, the person who answered the phone specifically asked us TWICE if we were sure we weren't looking for Hash House a Go Go.   I ordered a Spanish omelet.  It was pretty good.  Had a little bit of butter flavor, which I generally don't like, but the overall flavor of the omelet was decent.  The olives and jalapenos in there were very good.  I shared the omelet and was still full.  It came with a choice of 2 sides; I went with cottage cheese and hash browns. The hash browns were standard; I enjoyed them.  I thought the portions were pretty good.    The coffee was also decent.  It was good enough that I could drink it black.  There were also free refills on the coffee, which I certainly took advantage of.    They had several homemade sauces that I thought were notable.  The habanero sauce had a good flavor, and was kind of sweet and interesting.  The chipotle had a usual smoky flavor (I like the habanero sauce better).  They also had a really interesting spicy ketchup, but by the time I tried it I had so many hot sauces that my mouth was on fire, and I couldn't really notice the spiciness of the ketchup.  My friends ordered the corned beef hash and enjoyed it.  This place also has an impressive variety of homemade jam, desserts, and dog treats for sale.  I didn't get a chance to try all of it, but I thought it was rather neat.  I really like the cozy, quirky, homemade mom and pop feel here.  The prices were like a Denny's ($7-$9 for an omelet), but the food was more unique.   We came in a group of 10 people, and I thought service was reasonably fast, friendly, and they definitely kept the coffee coming.

Reviews.Author: Westie
Reviews.Content: Mary must be (more) famous for her breakfasts than her lunches because there were only two other tables occupied when we sat down at a little past noon.  We ordered cups of soup, Ann = potato, me = spicy chicken.  The potato soup was curiously thin and my soup, though spicy as advertised, was light on flavor with a few pieces of chicken that likely were added immediately prior to serving.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places to eat anywhere - it suits me and my tastes.  I usually get the Party Hash - the mix of flavors and the jalapeños are just great.  I get the eggs sunny side up, and sides of fruit and either grits or toast.  I especially enjoy the apple jalapeño jelly on the sourdough toast.  Multiple hash options, waffles, pancakes, biscuits and gravy - they have something for everyone.  It is not the fanciest place in town, and I like that.  Tucked away in a strip center at Sahara and Decatur.  The service is friendly.  We look forward to every trip here - this is our second day in a row to be here.  Give it a try - I think you will like it!!!

Reviews.Author: Jadira
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was okay. Service was pretty slow (at least for our table) and the food was mediocre. We ordered the Party Hash ($8.95) to share. It had corned beef, ham, roast beef, chicken, jalapenos, mushrooms, onions, and peppers served with 2 eggs, toast, and potatoes. It was good, but nothing I'd actually come back for. My boyfriend has actually been here before and he raved about the homemade jams they make. We saw the waitress go around to 2 other tables offering them jam from the tray she was holding for their, but she never came to us with it, so we had to go up to her and ask for some and she made the busboy bring some over to us. The selection was pretty awesome. They had apple butter, apple-jalapeno, habanero, strawberry, peach, watermelon, blueberry, raspberry, and grape. I went with the apple butter and Donald got watermelon. The apple butter was very tasty and the watermelon was interesting, but a little too sweet. I'd definitely come back here just to sample some of their other flavors.

Reviews.Author: Dania
Reviews.Content: You start with seating yourself. Besides the long wait to place your order the place is typically busy with very good mostly homemade food. Food is not to salt or overly done. Simple and tasty

Reviews.Author: Rafael
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem. No crowds no fluff just solid customizable breakfasts that taste real good and offer large size portions. Come here if your hungry and ask for Martha, she's the best friend of a hungry guy. Waffles are lite and delicious, French toast was vanilla flavored and sweet. Soooo good !   We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: ...as with Mr Mama's, friendly little local place with incredibly average food...thought I would find refuge in the home made condiments they use, but even those were poorly executed...ouch...

Reviews.Author: Cari
Reviews.Content: This place is great. It feel very homey. I bring my friends from out of town and they love this place. The food is delicious and the prices are reasonable. When you can, try the carrot cake, so yummy!

Reviews.Author: Marshall
Reviews.Content: When you first arrive you seat yourself, which is normally fine if the place has waiters who are ready and able to greet and serve customers (spoiler, this place doesn't). Instead, waiters, or waitresses, couldn't be bothered with such nonsense, and seem to want as little to do with you as possible. When I went with my wife, HH was in no way busy. When our waitress got around to our table, she was visibly in a rush and even said she had other tables to get to. Good thing we had been sitting there for a bit and were ready to order. After an even longer wait for our food to arrive, we were presented with food that couldn't compete with even the lowliest of diners. My waffle was literally, and I literally mean literally, tasteless. And the shot of syrup they give you does nothing to help.  My wife said her hash browns mainly consisted of grease; she ordered them specifically to be more crispy.  Again, our waitress could not have less to do with us if she tried. Randomly, in the middle of eating she quickly placed the check down on the corner of the table and darted off. She never once asked how the food was. She never once offered us anything else. She never once even asked if we need more water. Long story short, avoid this place. This is not one of those cool, hole in the wall places. This is a one star restaurant with one star service and one star food. Do yourself a favor, stay at home and make your own breakfast. Even if you can't cook, you'll at least be treated better.

Reviews.Author: Shez
Reviews.Content: I absolutely did not like this place and wish the 'Food Network' revisited to take away its credentials  As seen on Chopped .  We initially went to another nearby restaurant that we love, however, the wait was 25 minutes and since we were starving, we decided to try this restaurant.  The hostess told us 10 minutes but we ended up waiting twice as long. There wasn't any seating so we were forced to stand for that time with our active infant.  5 tables left and still we weren't seated because no one cleaned those tables off. The environment was old and unkempt.  The candy in the entrance was so old that I'm surprised they didn't notice.  My infant sat in a run down, un-assembled high-chair dated from 1989 and not fastened by buckles, but a mans waist belt.   Finally we ordered but I wish the waitress went over the menu because my meal wasn't what I expected.  The food was bland, mushy and oily, the waitress was aloof, I had to ask for more water and the lady behind us asked twice for a to-go box.  I hated my meal so much that I didn't eat it; first time I've ever not eaten a meal ordered.  HORRIBLE SERVICE, DEPRESSING FOOD and environment.

Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: Just amazing food! Mary's cooking skills are so great. Every kind of hash you want, homemade even. She even bakes amazing pastries.  Fried chicken and waffles are a must. AMAZING meatloaf. Better than grandma! Homemade jams, ketchup, and sauces. Very old school look. Want fancy, don't go to Mary's, but you want wonderful food, great service, and things homemade, Mary's is your place to go!!!!

Reviews.Author: Saliha
Reviews.Content: Came here because my regular place by work was under construction. Ummmm walking in it looks like a totally dive, but don't let that fool you.   Also, you might be melting while sitting in this place. It was probably at least 90 degrees in there. The atmosphere was pretty nasty, but the food was sooooo bomb!  Don't let the atmosphere throw you off. The food was excellent!

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: This place is a little hidden gem in Las Vegas. It looks a bit under rated upon first glance as it is pretty run down, and with folding tables. But don't let looks deceive you!  Our friend was looking for a place which served hash browns, and simple diner place for breakfast. We found this place on yelp, as Dennys had an extremely long wait everywhere in Vegas on a Sunday morning. This place is a bit informal (we waited about 10 minutes to seat ourselves).   Prices were very reasonable - I shared strawberry waffles with my friend which came with a side of bacon and eggs. The entre was about $10.95, which is a great deal for breakfast - especially for two people. The portions are definitely large enough to share with a friend. My friends ordered the omelet and breakfast plates, and all loved their dishes. The breakfast plates came with sides of toast, which had about 20 different jam varieties to choose from. I also ordered some orange juice -which was extremely sweet and fresh squeezed, always a great plus from a diner.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an off the strip place for breakfast. We got lucky and found this place.   Great homemade breakfast!   Don't miss it if you are in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: My sister suggested this place to us because of their lobster benne's .  I'm a big fan of Benedicts so of course I was eager to try this.  The restaurant is situated in a plaza that doesn't seem populated much.  I actually passed it while trying to find it.  The place is outdated and we literally sat on a folding picnic table since there was 6 of us.  Not sure why they couldn't push 2 four seater tables together.  I ordered the lobster benne with hash browns on the side.  My son had a short stack.  My sister decided to try some salmon dish for the first time with a side of their special white toast.  Apparent their white toast melts in your mouth.  This place also makes their own jams.  The waitress came out with a tray full of the different jams (pineapple, jalapeño, watermelon, apricot, grape and strawberry).  You can try as many as you like.  The food eventually came out and I must say the presentation was visually appealing.  After a few bits in, it seemed to get bland.  I added pepper since I never add salt to my food.. But that didn't solve it. The hollandaise sauce was bland.  I slowly gravitated to the lobster only and left behind the biscuit and sauce.  The hash browns were ordinary.  I did try the white toast with the grape jam and that was delicious.  Overall, it's ok.. Wouldn't drive across town to eat here but would recommend it if you want to try a mom and pop place.

Reviews.Author: Omar
Reviews.Content: I have been to many restaurants, usually I only post when there was something bad I experienced. This restaurant has done something that you don't usually experience nowadays.  Customer Service , i mean great customer service. We had our 1.5 year old niece with us, and the owner even let us use her kitchen to cook her food, since we were traveling.  The food now...we had typical american breakfast at a lot of places, I would say it is good enough to compete with the other ones. The owner was featured in  Chopped , and she deserves to be there.
