The service was great, our waitress went over and above to make sure we got everything we wanted. The jam....man oh man, need to try that Jalapeño or Lemon jam...over all a must try if you're visiting Las Vegas... Thanks to the owner and our server..!!

Reviews.Author: Douglas
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Mary's for over 15 years. Mary, Martha, and Darlene are always friendly and the food is delicious! My favorite is the party hash with their jalapeno seasoning and smokin' habanero sauce on top. It's so good that it compelled me to write my first Yelp review!

Reviews.Author: Leon
Reviews.Content: Love this place  Have enjoyed Mary's wonderful homemade style cooking for years . Always look forward to her daily specials  And the seasonal Hatch chilli creations  If your eating solo you can sit at the bar counte  Always  love to support the individual business owner  Enjoy !!

Reviews.Author: l
Reviews.Content: i ate hash house two days in a row this weekend.... i had to get my fix before i went back to l.a..... i give it 4 stars because my local friends that frequent the joint, dont like the service they receive from one of the ladies there, and ive only ordered one thing.... the party hash with fruit.... also the place is very plain in decor and took a while for the food... but  my friends say thats cuz everything is so  freshly made ......  if you like HASH, this is the best place to go because there were so many to choose from.... typically places just have corned beef hash, but this place has chicken hash, roast beef hash, and some others....  the food was good and not greasy like typical breakfast food, which i love........ also the fruit i ordered as a side was nice and fresh and not precut and old looking.... also, the HOMEMADE jam here for your bread is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Quisha
Reviews.Content: Actually found this place by accident last week, was actually trying to go to the Hash House a Go Go that is off the strip, but being the unobservant person I am I read the name wrong ended up here.  We decided to give it a shot since we were all starving, initially I regretted the decision because it took forver for our order to be taken and the food to come, but once it did it was SO delicious and fresh! I really liked that if what you wanted was not already a combo on the menu they were willing to create a combo for you (i.e. instead of the 4 pancakes by themselves you could get 2 with whatever side). The waitress was really nice and continued to check on us throughout the meal. Everyone was pleased with their meal and while the portion size was not as large as HHGG the quality was much better.

Reviews.Author: Kali
Reviews.Content: Spot on diner food. A bit of a redneck vibe first thing in the morning but quality coffee and breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Perry
Reviews.Content: I like corned beef hash, and breakfest in general, so I had to try this place out. On saturday's I like to eat a hearty meal after hitting the weights in the morning, and I go to Aloha Kitchen in the same plaza. I've seen this place before, but never tried it, but finally I did this past saturday.  I had the traditional corned beef hash, two eggs over easy, and you get two sides. I chose their country potatos and toast. Since I haven't been there before, I guess I made the right choice with their toast because their jelly/jams seem to be their main draw. They have a huge selection that they bring for you to choose from. I had apple butter, rasberry and peach. They were all good!  The corned beef hash looks different, redish and chopped into ultra small bits. I like mine to be a bit meatier, but this was both different and good. I'll try and post a picture of it so you can check it out. My current favorite for corned beef hash is Weiss Deli in Henderson...and it still remains tops.  I like this place and it seems to be family run. A few people came in and mistook it for Hash House A Go Go. It's also next to a Smoke Shop, and some even thought they could score some good hashish in here...they too were wrong (j/k!)

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: We just went back for our second visit. The hash dishes are really good. The Party Hash consists of too many ingredients to remember, and is very flavorful. Our server was very friendly on both ocassions. The only thing keeping us from giving 5 stars is that we were overlooked both times when we first were seated. You seat yourself, and can be ignored (there are two rooms, and it is difficult to see us where we chose to sit). We will definitely be returning for the breakfast!

Reviews.Author: Fou
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do don't ask for a booth.  Wow talk about rudeness.  They closed the back area.  Which is where the booths are.  We asked to sit in a booth and the hostess told us that they were all closed. We asked her if we could please sit ten feet back in the closed area to sit in a booth.  She was very rude and said no. I told you that area is closed.  Having no interest in sitting at a table in the middle of the room we left.  She could have cared less. Sad. The waitress would have like our business and tip  I'm sure.

Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Terrible service. The place was 3/4 empty and it took 45 minutes to get our food. These guys are banking on their tv exposure.

Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: Yes this place is absolutely our  Must Have Breakfast  spot whenever we are in Vegas!! We always order the Corn Beef Hash, best i've ever had! I must say though, since Yelp, this hole in the wall spot has become extremely popular (or shall I say crowded). The last time we were here, the waitress was a bit overwhelmed with customers however, she did handle it like a champ :)

Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: We look forward to seeing Mary, Darlene and Martha on a weekly basis. This is one of our favorite breakfast places in town and have been coming here for years. Any hash is beyond amazing and everything taste like mom's cooking!  T

Reviews.Author: Kendrea
Reviews.Content: Decided to move a little out of the overpriced Vegas Strip and was totally amazed! Went to the highly priced buffets to the low ball ones. Nothing compares to this place! I had the meatloaf hash and wasn't disappointed. It's a small mom and pop establishment who doesn't love those. Locals to tourist inside.

Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: This place is about as good of a breakfast place as you'll find...anywhere! The lamb hash was delicious! The cinnamon rolls and sausage patty were exceptional! Highly recommend ditching the strip and getting with Hash House!

Reviews.Author: H
Reviews.Content: So I read a few reviews before deciding to come here. A fan of chopped I figure it'd be worth a try. As we entered on Friday at 1pm, we were surprised by the lack of crowd. Three table of patrons.  We read the sign after dumbly standing there for a minute or two without anyone greeting us and we seated ourselves. Looking around we saw many tables with dishes not bused. We sat. And sat. And sat. No one came to greet us. The one and only server finally came and took order from a nearby table. Did not acknowledge us. We are a table of 7... Luckily I had time on my hands so I read more reviews. On one of them a reviewer mentioned  the egg and I   nearby. We walked out without a goodbye.  We were famished. Luckily the egg and I seemed close by. Keep in mind this was a spur of the moment decision. Triggered by the lack of service at our original destination. We arrive at egg and was greeted by a smiley hostess. The place was crowded. We informed her we wouldn't mind two tables of four. She smiled and said she has just the space for us. They pushed two tables together and made us a space by the booths.  Service was prompt. Our waitress introduced herself as Jackie. The food was delicious.  bottom line is the reviews seem to give the food good remarks. However we were turned off by the lack of service and never made it to the food part.  Even if the food was five star worthy, the overall experience would have netted 3 stars at best. Being a small business owner myself, my constructive criticism for the owner would be to over staff part timers so short staffing does not ruin the reputation of the establishment. The difference at your competitor was night and day. As a result we are a loyal egg and I customer at the moment

Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: This is complicated.  I was there last week for a late breakfast.  First of all their portions are huge.  I took my Dad, he has gotton the pancakes, huge and delicious.  I decided to go with the cornbeef hash.  It was really boring, not too bad of taste but just not very memorable and I think it may have been sitting.  The service is excellent and I did see they have fried chicken and waffles yummy, which is what I am going to try next time.  I liked it here, but I think I'll like it more once I order something that really gets my eye.  I recomend it but stay away from the corned beef hash, not nasty but just not worth it.

Reviews.Author: Junica
Reviews.Content: This place is so good!  Way better than the rest. Fresh and EVERYTHING is homemade. Mary don't take no shortcuts.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We  eat here all the time but Ol Mary had a understaffed situation on Monday December 28th. 45 minutes to get Cold food 45$ down the drain. We will be taking a break from this place for a while.

Reviews.Author: Esteban
Reviews.Content: Great chicken garlic hash.   Pooched eggs were perfect. Service was nice and. The restaurant was clean and very chill.  Little hole in the mall definitely going back.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Oh yeah! What a great find. Not Hash House A Go Go but completely off the strip and local. The hash was delicious and the jams were a nice touch. I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: OMG the video is sooooooooo gooood!  You have to watch the video they posted.  And you have to go eat here!  It's my favorite breakfast place in Vegas.  My roommate is also obsessed with this place.  The staff has mostly been there for years so they are now all friends of ours we go visit a couple times a week.  If you are alone, sit at the bar.  I have had some of the most interesting conversations with strangers at that bar.    Always ask for the specials and make sure you wave at Martha, Darlene and Mary for me. :)

Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could give a lower star for this place.  Let me just start off by saying I really tried to give it a shot because the owner was on Chopped, so I assumed it would be a hidden gem. Nope.  Our server was rude, pushy and tried to rush us to order because she  had a 45 top that was coming in . Once we were ready to order she rushed through everything, spoke over us, so we kept having to repeat our order, and never have us her full attention. I got the asparagus and Swiss omelette, mediocre at best. It was luke warm and she brought the wrong side dishes. ( White and Sourdough are two completely different styles of bread) The biggest complaint I have however...the hash on my friends plate was the Salmon Hash, which would be fine but she ordered the Super Hash, and in fact hates Salmon. So either they aren't cleaning their flat top or they served the wrong hash. Good thing she isn't allergic right?  The staff is older, which I sometimes prefer, they have a way of making you feel at home.  The entire time I was there I felt uneasy, in everyone's way and inconveniencing my waitress.   The 'As seen on Chopped' sign on the window should be taken down if this is the general expectation here.

Reviews.Author: Silvia
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is a hidden gem. The food is homemade and simply delicious, nothing pretentious about it. The jams were so comforting and delicious. The staff despite the restaurant being busy, was friendly and attentive. This restaurant now ranks in my top 3 breakfast spots.

Reviews.Author: Garett
Reviews.Content: As far as breakfast joints go,this one is pretty tasty. They are tucked away in the southwest corner of Sahara/Decatur and it takes a keen eye to find them. Once you set your sights on the place, get ready to grub. The food is great and the portions are generous. It's a more laid back atmosphere and the service isn't speedy quick, so don't plan on a quick in and out. I got chicken fried steak and eggs with home fries and savored every bite. I was able to subsitute a pancake (she brought me two) for the toast. One of the best hotcakes I've had in Vegas. Not to be confused with the  a go-go , this place is unique unto itself, featuring homemade jellies. I was a little confused by the Christmas coffee mugs in September, though, and one of my co-workers was a little surprised when they cleaned the table and wiped it off right into his lap. Not quite sure what happened there, but it was good for a laugh and not bad enough to keep us from coming back.

Reviews.Author: Lesie
Reviews.Content: This place was a sore disappointment. After hearing about it on the Food Network and reading about it in Saveur magazine, you know this that this place makes the best hash in all of Vegas. When we finally got here due to confusion from the cab driver (he thought we wanted to go to Hash A Go Go), The place was hot and under staffed. We followed the sign and sat ourselves. There was no option to add bacon onto any dish, and I never got my toast that I thought came with my hash. It was just one lady that morning doing everything though, so maybe she forgot.  The hash themselves tasted like decent hash, nothing spectacular though, and I never tried any of their special jams since I had no toast.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: After searching every hotel/casino coffee shop menu online, as well as most of the local breakfast/lunch places, I finally found a place in town that makes a proper Monte Cristo sandwich!  This little place in the Decatur & Sahara area does the Monte Cristo as it should be done: Thinly sliced ham, turkey & Swiss cheese on french toast, batter-dipped, then deep fried.  For those of you who have never had one, it may sound a bit heavy, unhealthy, fattening, and it is all of that.  It's not something that you should really eat on a regular basis, I'm sure there are tons of calories in there, but every once in a while, it's a wonderful treat!  At Mary's it comes with your choice of a side dish for $8.95, a really good value for the amount of food that you get.  The only drawback for me was the fresh fruit that you can order as a side is always strawberries & bananas.  I would prefer the traditional fresh cantaloupe, honeydew and grapes that I've had at other places in the past.  Not a big deal in the grand scheme of things.  If your a fan of the Monte Cristo, do yourself a favor and check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: This is a cute breakfast option. The servers are all welcoming and professional. My husband liked the hash. I tried the fresh fruit side and Mary's eggs on biscuits. Good thing we were very happy splitting a good cinnamon bun because the food was brought over on a steamship from Timbuktu, or so we thought. Lots of regulars. It was busy but they have a quick turnaround of tables. It would be a magnet for breakfast if the kitchen got orders out in a more timely fashion but I would go and try other menu items because of the very sweet staff.

Reviews.Author: Janette
Reviews.Content: Solid service and even better food! The corn beef hash and the biscuits n gravy are amazing. Their homemade jams/jellies are super cute and delicious too. Off the strip with a super homey feel.

Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: The sausage patty breakfast is delicious. Watermelon jam was delicious. There's nothing  Vegas  about the place, in fact I felt like I was back in Effingham, Illinois. The service was perfect. If you think it takes too long to get your food you're probably used to eating out of a bag in your car.

Reviews.Author: Cesar
Reviews.Content: Ordered breakfast for the crew. Mary was really nice over the phone. I went in there and saw that she was running the entire place. Made me feel good to support a hardworking lady's business. Mary greeted me and she ensured I had everything I needed. The food was amazing... Seemed very home made. The place looks like your moms house... Very cozy and coffee fresh and ready to be served. The pancakes were amazing .... Wanting to go back already

Reviews.Author: darin
Reviews.Content: Short story: come here for slow, crappy service and sub-par food.  Long story: Not knowing any better, I figured we would give Hash House a try given the 1 hr wait at the HHAGG. Big mistake.   Walking through the door, I get the feeling this is my kind of place--  homey, seat yourself, etc. (In reality, it was actually like stopping for breakfast at my ex-mother-in-law's house after I ran over her cat. But I really don't have an ex-mother-in-law nor did I run over her cat.)  But back to breakfast-- after we seat ourselves, we wait 5 minutes before we are handed menus. (Were we supposed to grab them ourselves, I wonder? Possible faux pas which I will own.) But I think the icy stare from the owner/waitress was unnecessary and you could have asked for our beverage order...or just greeted us...anything.   Coffee seems to take forever to arrive, and while we are waiting to order, I realize that the folks at two other tables have been/are still waiting for their food. (I thought folks were wrapping up their meal, but the fatigue on their faces was not from being overstuffed, it was from malnourishment.)  Now, based on other reviews, you might think that we were here on a particularly busy morning or something. Something, anything rational to explain the long wait for food. No, I think it has to do with a kitchen staff (actually I only saw 1 guy) who is not a short order cook. It looked like he was preparing 1 plate at a time...and slowly.  I order the corned beef hash, my wife picks the salmon and eggs. (She admitted she was delusional.) While the hash may be made to order, it was unremarkable. My wife's salmon was overcooked beyond recognition and yet, her eggs and home fries were cold. We tell our server and ask her to take it off the bill (because my wife will kill someone if she has to wait for something else to come out of the kitchen).   So we get the bill, and surprise, she didn't charge for the salmon. (Reflecting back, I did say that the salmon was overcooked and we didn't want it... I did not say that we don't want to pay for the cold eggs and home fries...what was I thinking.)  OK, so I realize this is your livelihood and you can't just give away food the same way you do at a buffet (or Denny's) but do you see how it might be a bit offensive to charge for the barely edible food on the plate that was not sent back? Like we go around sending food back so we can get a meal comped...   Lesson learned-- never eat here again. Even if the HHAGG has an hour wait.   P.S. I hear HHAGG has a second location in Imperial Palace... I would go to the strip before going back to the craptastic Hash House.

Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: Mary's Hash House experience was unusual. Definitely a hole in the wall diner. Upon arriving, my partner and I noticed dishes piled high against the wall of the bar area, at the tables in the main room, and later, we discovered the same at every empty table in the second dining room that we were seated at. We waited for at least 5 minutes along side two other groups of people for someone to welcome us. I believe it was Mary herself who added us to a waiting list, and told us it would be about 10 minutes before they would be able to clean off a table for us. We watched as the waitstaff wandered around the dirty tables as in a state of confusion, and never saw a dedicated buser the entire time we were there. We had plenty of time to review the menu while waiting at the front, so when we were sat, we ordered everything immediate, in hopes to speed up the process. We were sitting among dirty tables the entire time , which made us feel uneasy, and our order took forever. The food was good, but not great, and with the dirty tables all around us, we didn't feel like we could enjoy our food. We were perplexed, considering both of us have worked in the service industry, and have experienced busy periods during our shifts. Looking around, it didn't appear to be that busy, just a totally unorganized older waitstaff. The jalapeño jam was bright and delicious. Strangely enough, the jam was brought around in a tray that resembled a Jell-O shot tray, so that added to the uniqueness of that odd place. I'm not going back, and I certainly would not recommend this place to friends. We waited 50 minutes for our food, and the diner wasn't even half full at any point during our time there.

Reviews.Author: Cali
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this is not blah blah a go go..... this place is about food, not fancy presentation nor fantastic service but your basic  diner' type service w/ great food.  I had the house hash (of course) or hash house?  This was some good hash, peppers n onions diced up, hash browns, eggs over medium and toast. Add ketchup and Tabasco, then walla.... a masterpiece...  They have a daily selection of jams, I tried the Jalepeno (spicy n sweet, very interesting...) and the strawberry (yummy, like fresh strawberries)  If you want no nonsense, good breakfast, then this is it!  I plan on trying blah blah a go go next, just to experience the whole a go go thing...... but not to compare....til next time, good eating a go go!

Reviews.Author: Latreece
Reviews.Content: Great family diner.  Everything is fresh and homemade.  Can't leave without trying the homemade jelly. Love the owner Mary is awesome. Great variety of different hashes. Sage sausage is made to order hand patted patty. Just enough sage and thyme.  Can't get enough of this place.

Reviews.Author: Bonbon
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome place for breakfast. It was not too big, not too noisy, fast service and food was delicious.  Its an old school family diner with their regulars. I had the vegetarian eggs benedict with potato fries. I ordered the hashbrowns but I didnt mind. What made the meal was the homemade jams on the yummy bread and all of them were fantastic. I sprinkled the jalapeno spice on the table and I stopped talking to finish my food. Good sign.

Reviews.Author: Pim
Reviews.Content: For several months, my friend had been hyping up this mysterious breakfast restaurant that apparently had the best jam ever. We finally went together and it was very underwhelming to say the least.  FOOD Everything was literally just okay and unremarkable. The jams we got to try were definitely good, but my expectations were too high and they unfortunately fell short.  SERVICE Service was extremely slow and there was only one waitress for a nearly packed house. As a result, it took us a long time to even request the jams and I don't recall the lady smiling even once.  LOCATION Very central and convenient location. Mary's obvious a local hole-in-the-wall type of place. Parking is plentiful.  Yelp 100 Challenge - 2016 [4/100]

Reviews.Author: Daren
Reviews.Content: Nice little find. Came to watch a friend get a tattoo next door and was hungry. Loved the home fries. Really good thick cut perfectly cooked crispy bacon. Service A+. Will come back again if we're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Interesting menus and great food. Service is excellent! Very clean, well organized place.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: NOT WORTHY. It Claims As Seen On Food Network Chopped. I Think They Got CHOPPED ON ROUND 1. Awful Service and Dry Food. I Believe They Serve You Left Overs From The Previous Day. They Just Have good Jelly But Not Good Food. Sorry But I Wont Waste my Money Or Time Again. The Place Smells Really Bad Like Old People Smell and The Decor In The. Restaurant is Like Old and Smelly Like Old Wood type. If You Want Good Food This Is not Your STOP.

Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service, amazing homemade jam. Even bought some to take home. Will definately come back when I'm back in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: This place has the best food. The sausage patty and the home fries are a must order. Of course you also need some of the homemade preserves. You have to try this place whether you are a local or a visitor. Everything is homemade and the owner/chef has been on chopped. Homemade cinnamon buns and everything you could ever want. I know that the biscuits and gravy are so good that they remind you of that good southern cooking. I frequent this place quite a few times through out the month. If you are looking for a good place for breakfast you can't miss with this place!

Reviews.Author: Leonard
Reviews.Content: I decided to try the hash house after seeing the commercials in our hotel room. Unfortunately, it was not the same place I seen on TV. I decide to give them a try since they were extremely busy & the food looked really good.   At first the waitress seemed a bit rude after we sat down. It appeared our waitress was MIA, so another waitress to our order for our drinks. We decided to try the ham steak & eggs. We also got a waffle to share. The waitress brought out their homemade jelly. I choose the apple jalapeño & the peach jelly. They both tasted really good. Our ham steak was delicious.  Everything tasted so fresh!!!   I will definitely, come again when I am in town. It turned out to be a nice experienced.   Our waitress turned out to be really nice...   FYI: If your in town, this a good place to eat!!! Just keep in mind it's not the place you see advertised on tv. That place is Hash House A Go Go.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Hash is bad ass. Jelly is awesome. Service is perfect.

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Soooooo.....my review  Hell Yeah!!!  This place is awesome from the fresh homemade jelly to most tender most juiciest pork chops I've ever had(one thing a bit less on salt) crispy hash browns beautiful over medium eggs.  This place is great near the strip and services are very very friendly and on point...it's hidden jem so if ur GPS can't find it...it's next to a Hawaiian restaurant in ol circuit city Plaza right behind super pawn

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Not  a go go  I repeat, not  a go go.  That would just be disrespectful to this little gem in the rough.  No, it's not fancy. No, their dishes don't match. And no, you won't have to take out a second mortgage to eat breakfast or lunch here. Good food is what I'm all about and this place hits the nail on the head.   When in doubt, just go to Hash House (how many times do I have to tell you it's not a go go?). Sometimes you just need a little hash in your life. This place hashes like a professional hasher. Awesome flavor, great texture, and more importantly it feels like your getting a home cooked meal. Hash House is everything a chain restaurant isn't, which is why I like it so much. If you're looking for a basic breakfast they do that exceptionally well. Want something a little fancier like a Monty Cristo? Yep. They do that well. Personally, I'm more of a pancake and egg kind of fella. Mary, the owner, was featured for her pancakes on The Cooking Channel, so she has street cred. I can vouch for those tasty hot cakes, they're off the hook.   Their homemade jams are superb. Generally 10+ choices and usually a few unique flavors.   Hash House is definitely a  regulars  joint. Become one, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Dear Hash House,  Yes I went to you by accident thinking you were that other hash house.. But I still ended up staying and not mentioning it or causing some awkward public scene. You probably knew I was looking for the other hash house and maybe that's why I got the cold service from you.  The waitress (owner?) seemed like a real nice down to earth lady with the other customers who were most likely regulars. But she gave us about 60 seconds worth of attention the whole time and we just quietly ate our food and left.  The food was simple, I had eggs, waffle, and a bacon. It wasn't all that flavorful, but edible and decent.  Sorry for making the mistake,  Ed

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Came in today to have two orders of biscuits and gravy with my girlfriend breakfast was good coffee was good service was good we'll be back again.

Reviews.Author: Donald
Reviews.Content: You walk in and you have to seat yourself , there is only one server and you don't get greeted till 10 minutes later .. I ordered my food at 11:10 and it's already 11:45 and still nothing .  Stay home and make your own breakfast

Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: like others before us-we were trying to go to hash house a go go!!! but who knew we had to specify between 3 different places (now that there is one on the strip)....but anyways-it was TINY!!! and the staff was very homely...buuutttttttt think about it-why are you going there?? for a good breakfast and they didn't disappoint....i ALWAYS order my hash browns extra crispy and this was the first time in my entire life that they were actually cooked to crispyness....prices were great...i mean-who doesn't love paying 'normal' prices for stuff in vegas!!! idk if i would go back but you won't leave disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Sheree
Reviews.Content: The good was so delicious and fresh. I had the fried chicken and waffles omg thee best!!!! Repeat is a must!!!!

Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: First of all I KNOW ITS NOT HASH HOUSE A GO GO so sending me messages that say  your review is wrong because you went to someplace that you didn't know where you were  or something won't change my review...  Basically Decent food ... Bad service.  We sat down the restaurant was maybe 40% full. It took 15minutes for someone to show up and take our drink order (no fountain drinks.. only $1.40 cans of soda???)  It took another 15-20 mins for us to get the attention of our waitress. I finally had to send my son to search for her. She took our orders and dissapeared again.  When they brought the food (finally) it was really good. Everyone loved the homemade jellies. I had the super hash which has everything. It was a little dry but good.  So after being ignored for an hour and getting the absolute minimum service (the bus-lady helped us more.. she brought my forgotten toast) I tipped $7 on a $52 bill. The waitress looked at the tip line on the ticket and scowled... I don't want to get into a  how much to tip  battle, but if you give crappy service and then scowl at a ~15% tip then I'm done with you.  We won't be back

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: If your a visitor, this place is off the strip.... way, way off the strip. Have a rental, no problem? Need a taxi, it's gonna be pricey!  That being said, after driving out of our way to visit the place before it closed, I can honestly say  Whats the big deal ?  I really didnt find anything done exceptionally well.   I guess if you compare this place to (gasp) Dennys or even an IHOP, you may think its THE PLACE to go, but I just really didnt get it.  Maybe because it was the end of the day (arrived after 1pm) the staff was tired, the cook didnt give extra effort, or whatever reason it just was overpriced and bland.

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Hash House (not to be confused with Hash House A Go Go) is simply incredible. This is my kind of place. I tried the chicken and waffles with grits and entered breakfast heaven. For added appeal, the large selection of homemade jams (I tried the watermelon) will keep me coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Items selected:  Coffee Biscuit with Housemade Jam (Strawberry, Apple Butter) Monte Cristo Carrot Cake  Part of the local dining scene since 1994, long before San Diego import  Hash House A Go-Go  splashed down with gluttonous portions at no less than three separate spots, Mary's Hash House on Decatur had always been a place I intended to go and yet for whatever reason it was not until I realized the owner hailed from my home state of Ohio that I finally committed to an early morning visit, a 6:05 am arrival finding a pair of regulars already present amidst the cozy confines as Mary and one other tended both kitchen and front of house in the most pleasant of manners.  Perhaps the most homey of places I've found since relocating to Sin City with aged wood furniture beneath sturdy tables and papered walls decorated by assorted knick-knacks dotting the two rooms it was with hot coffee, medium or dark, plus a menu of farm fresh favorites that I was greeted and although nearly all of the hashes and griddled favorites sounded good it was to traditional favorites that I turned, the meal kicked off by a rustic slice of carrot cake with tangy cream cheese layered on just that morning as I awaited my main course.  Truly 'home-style' with everything made in-house and to order including breads, jams, and jellies it would be perhaps twenty minutes and three coffee top-offs before my primary plate would arrive but proving the adage that good things come to those who wait it was with stunning results when the Monte Cristo was delivered; a true golden fried version with ham, turkey, and Swiss sealed inside ready to be gilded by maple syrup for a perfect sweet meets savory bite trumping any version of the classic sandwich that I've found in Las Vegas to date - a golden buttermilk biscuit with two of nearly a dozen types of jam offered as an alternative to homefries or potatoes no less impressive and briefly making me long for the Midwest...though certainly not for the February weather.

Reviews.Author: Colin
Reviews.Content: Went in around 10:30am on a Saturday morning and had no problem getting seating. Sat at the bar and interacted with several staff members, all of whom were super friendly.   As the restaurant name suggests, they have a lot of hashes to choose from. I went with the salmon hash with a side of home fries and fruit. It was tasty but I think it could have been seasoned a little better. I eat a lot of 'clean' meals and so I crave good seasoning when I eat more traditionally.   The hash didn't sit on my stomach really heavy like they typically do so I really appreciated that. They have a bunch of different jellies to try which was kinda cool. I was boring and went with grape vs. a fancier selection.   I wasn't absolutely crazy about it but I'd go back and give something else a try.

Reviews.Author: Felipe
Reviews.Content: I found my new favorite Breakfast place in Las Vegas. This place has the  soul  that is missing from another local jaunt The Egg & I chain.   The owner, Mary, was right there cooking breakfast for the customers, making delicious feshly baked biscuits and phenomenal, unique hash style eggs.   The server was very fast and helpful and the place is cosy and clean. When i went it was not busy but i cant  imagine how they deal when they're slammef. I highly recommend this place for breakfast and it looks like they have an awesome american lunch menu.

Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: It's one of Las Vegas hidden gems. It is off strip in a plaza near a barber shop. In the Decatur plaza. My husband ordered thick cut bacon eggs with home fries and sourdough toast with there homemade jam. You have to get toast to try there jams you will not be disappointed. Also ask Mary for some sweet tea she makes it from scratch just for you. This tea is unlike I have ever tasted before. Defiantly will be coming back for another visit.

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: The food was good, however our waitress was very short. She took our order and brought us our food. She never asked if we needed anything else. She left our check as soon as she brought the food and never came back. We wanted refills on our drinks and their house hot sauce but we were ignored. Sadly the service made our experience bad. Another waitress was pleasant we just were not lucky to have her.

Reviews.Author: Trecie
Reviews.Content: Back in Vegas and of course had to stop for breakfast.  This is always a good choice, but it looked as if the hash portions has gotten smaller.

Reviews.Author: Tahni
Reviews.Content: We came here on a recommendation 2 days ago for breakfast. Had meatloaf hash. Yum. They also had house made jellies in several flavors, we chose apple jalapeno. I would just eat the jelly and skipped the toast! Service a little bit slow but not bad. Prices about the same as other places we normally go. Would come here again.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We sit at the bar and drink coffee and eat some good homemade hash. Never had a bad meal here. It is small so if they are busy then you will wait.great weekday place to grab a meal

Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: Just walked out of this restaurant after ordering could not bear to wait for our food. before we even ordered the server was running a vacuum through the restaurant loud as all can be.  We actually pulled up the health department rules on our phone to show the server and she seemed very uninterested her biggest concern was the fact that they were closing and 40 minutes as she rushed around through the restaurant attention of her presents was also on bearable. There were about 5 tables in there eating listening to the vacuum cleaner girl as we watched her vacuum right up against tables where people were actually eating at.    You can see the cooks working through the window from the dining room and we watched one of the cooks picking up utensils while making food and a bottle full of mail anyway he had absolutely no gloves I'm neither did the other cook we could see through the window in the back kitchen.  Just seeing a cook preparing food without clothes on health code violation number to then when our server went to get the coffee the sanitizer f*** it was leaning up against the coffee pot switch also was another violation and we said the heck with this place we're out of here as we were leaving one of the servers asked why we told her and all she did was turn around and go in the back kitchen eat at your own risk.

Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Found this place this morning and had the BEST breakfast here. Homemade cinnamon rolls and an assortment of homemade jelly. Martha gave us such great service and obviously loves the food and working here. Fun. Loved it!!

Reviews.Author: Amatrix
Reviews.Content: Really awful. Came in at 11 am, sat down and left at noon without food. Sat in the seat facing the kitchen- witnessed our waitress picking (not scratching, digging deep) her nose then reaching for toast and arranging potatoes on a plate. Saw the 2 male cooks pushing each other and playing in the kitchen- swinging bacon around in the air and pushing each other's hats off (so they had to readjust their hats and scratch their faces without washing hands or changing gloves) before making French toast. I saw  Mary,  apparently the owner, cooking eggs and wiping her nose/sweaty forehead on the back of her gloved hand- without changing gloves or washing hands. Saw my cottage cheese sitting out for more then half an hour without refrigeration and my husband's fries for more then 20 minutes without light/heat. Waited 15 minutes to let our cashier know (after the other had walked by us waiting at the register- she also ran into my chair really hard and just kept going while trying to serve people, after I spilled my coke from her knocking a leg on my chair- no apology or offer of a free coke, which they only have in bottles for crying out loud) we were leaving to pay for the coke, only to have a hand waved at us and told to just leave. We wanted to pay for the coke but we were so fed up we left. Hour and a half to be subjected to rude waitresses, unsanitary and dangerous food, and then treated like garbage.

Reviews.Author: Tania
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting order a Hash. Makes sense since that is the name...I had Blueberry pancakes and they were meh. The corned beef hash was fab. So was the cinnamon rolls.

Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Didn't want to eat in a casino.  So I didn't.  This was so nice. Lovely staff.  Homemade jellies.  I had the jalapeno jelly and raspberry. Wow. Really good bottomless filter coffee. I am so lonely. This was respite. OK, sure, there's a TV on. Somebody said that. That's fine. You're not there to eat the TV.  -Ron

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Best hash. I've never seen a selection quite like it. I had the roast lamb hash, very good I wish there was one back east. Great selection of home made jellies too.

Reviews.Author: Wej
Reviews.Content: What an amazing down to earth real breakfast joint! I love the no bullshit good food atmosphere!!! It's nothing too special, I mean it's eggs and potatoes... But you feel special... Like your somewhere worth being.... The owner has been in several food network competition shows and is usually there.... It is busy often!!! The grits are my favorite!!! They make cinnamon rolls from scratch and they are good!!! Also, they make jams... My favorite is the jalapeño one!!! They serve lunch too.... But, I have only gone for breakfast!!!! I have been there so many time!!! You all should just go... It's just good...

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: Delicious!!!!!! Found it by chance and love trying local places. Worth the drive away from the strip. Great prices and good portions!!! Friendly staff and prompt service. Wonderful homemade jelly and bread. Yummy!!!

Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for years and always have a great experience.  The food is clean not greasy and Mary the Chef and owner creates special dishes and takes diner/breakfast food to the five star level workout all the smoke and mirrors of the high end places.   The place is clean and homey and the staff who's been there for years are fast and friendly.  I took my son here today and he ordered the chicken hash..... I can't believe he ate the whole thing!

Reviews.Author: Juleta
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous!! Home made jams (the apple butter is to die for). The best cuts of bacon. Friendly staff, nice bold coffee with flavored creamer! A must visit!

Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: So my friend wanted to come to this place because it the chef was on Food Networks' Chopped.  Sure, breakfast.  What can go wrong?  This is clearly a locals place, but I have to wonder, has this place gone downhill since being on tv?  We went on a Saturday, a bit after the brunch rush, it wasn't even lunch time yet.  They were not busy, and it was  seat yourself   A server came pretty quickly to take our order, but man did we wait FOREVER for our food.  It was 30 minutes (no exaggeration, I timed it) after she took our order, and we were STILL waiting for our food.  We looked around, first off they were NOT busy, the place was not full, but there were people that were already seated before us that were also still waiting for their food.  We also never saw our server again.  No one came to check in on us, no one came to check on drinks, or to tell us sorry it's taking so long, but the food is on it's way.  We didn't order anything complicated, a Ham hash and a corned beef hash.  That's it, we didn't even substitute anything.  Seriously - all this stuff should have been prepped and ready to just throw together.  I don't know what they were doing in the kitchen but come on, this was completely unacceptable.   The food at least came out piping hot, so at least we had that. I'm only giving it 2 stars because the food was decent, but nothing to write home about.  It wasn't too bad for the price, but when Egg and I is not too far away, I will never come here again.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: OMG! Where do I start? I've been going here for years, starting with their old location on Spring Mtn and now here at their new place on Decatur. I've a couple places I like to hit for breakfast, but Mary's Hash House is my favorite. It's not slick and fancy, there's no trendy music, nor do I have the choice of 20 different pancake flavors. What it does have is comfy casual good ol' home cooking, and that's usually what I'm in the mood for.   I usually get The Skinny with a side of Super Hash. Darlene and the other server (sorry, can't remember your name!) always bring around a tray of home made jellies to choose from, which I love! Mary, the owner, is often busy in the back doing much of the cooking herself, yet still finds time to come out and ask patrons how they're doing.   Now some people might complain that sometimes it takes a bit longer to get your food. I don't consider this a drawback because to me, this shows that most of the stuff is cooked to order and coming out fresh just for me. That's the way I like it and that's why I keep coming back.

Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: Looks like I'm not the only one who mistook this place for  Hash House A Go Go.   Well, not me actually.  My uncles were in charge of choosing dining options for our Vegas trip.  So we stumbled upon this first.  At least I had the pleasure of dining at both places.    Some items are pretty amazing and memorable, but I thought the majority was pretty disappointing.  So here is the breakdown of what we had to share with five people and what I thought of them.   Greatness! - Homemade Jams and Jellies (especially the Apple-Jalapeno), Biscuits & Gravy w/ Homemade Sausage Patty, Triple Decker Turkey Bacon Sourdough Sandwich Just OK - Party Hash (good with Tabasco and still better than  Hash House A Go Go ) Never Again -  Lamb Hash, Veggie Hash, Beef Barley Soup (really really bad...probably as good as canned)

Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Based on an all around review (not just the food), I only gave this amazing place 4 stars.   I'll start with the  not so awesome . The cleanliness of the dining area could be better and the bathroom wasn't that pleasant but the part that got me the most is the seating. It can be a little cramped.   THE FOOD!! I will definitely go to this spot many times for the food. Everything I tried (three dishes) was wonderful.   The main dishe I had was the Argentina eggs Benedict with mariscos (shrimp). The spices they use with the hollandaise sauce goes perfect with the poached eggs and shrimp. I will definitely get that again.   It is a little off the strip but worth the drive. If you are in the Las Vegas area, I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Daisy Alejandra
Reviews.Content: Try their apple butter jam. Homemade and very delicious!  Very affordable and hearty portions. Delicious food. Away from the busy strip. If you have a car this is def the place to have breakfast at.

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for homemade, huge portions of delicious breakfast, this is your spot. I came here right before we were about to leave to go back home, and trust me, I did not want to leave. I ordered the party hash, which really was like a party in my mouth. My cousin ordered a side of the pancakes, which were a stack of crispy-on-the-edges-and-super-fluffy goodness. There was only one server on the floor (it was a weekday) and she was very patient and kind with us as we were having trouble with deciding on what to order. As I went over to the restroom, I noticed a little window that peeked into the kitchen, and I was actually able to recognize Mary back there, cooking! I even saw her ask a couple customers how they really wanted their eggs. That's when you know you're eating fresh, quality homemade breakfast/brunch.

Reviews.Author: Jarrett
Reviews.Content: MUST TRY THIS PLACE. You are likely to meet Mary in person; she's absolutely delightful. Make sure you try a good selection of her homemade jam recipes. The best part, though, is the hash! The Party Hash is fantastic! This is just the perfect place. Great service, great prices, great coffee, GREAT FOOD. Anyone living near here or just visiting, you HAVE to come try it.

Reviews.Author: Glo
Reviews.Content: I love going to Mary's Hash House, not to be confused with the mediocrity of the chain Hash House a Go-Go. This is a little Vegas Gem that I enjoy seeing busy and like to tell people about.     It's a no frills kind of joint (none of the coffee mugs match, which gives it extra charm to me) with excellent food! I go for the Corned Beef Hash, which is really something special in this world! They also make a killer Monte Cristo that is my second go-to. Upon straying from the hash, everything else I've tried has been quite tasty. Don't skip on the sides either. The grits are so so delicious, as well as the homemade jams!

Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: Super hash was amazing.  Big assortment of fresh jelly's and awesome spicy ketchups.   Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: jane
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to try this fabulous restaurant. My cousin and I were deciding if it was open since it is a hidden gem!! The turkey hash was excellent! The homemade jellies were amazing! Especially the watermelon and jalapeno! My lovely cousin who is a Las Vegas resident bought me 2jars to take back to Hawaii. MARY the owner is so friendly she gave me a hug!! What a gracious lady!!!

Reviews.Author: Kellers
Reviews.Content: Literally the best cinnamon roll I've ever eaten. The service was great and the food was amazing. I'm coming back every time I visit Las Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Lupita
Reviews.Content: Food is really good! Yes the service is not so great and the kitchen is slow, but the prices good and I really enjoyed the ham hash especially with added jalapeño! I would  definitely go again. And they had there own jams, which are really good too!

Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: We were actually looking for Hash House a go go, but we stumbled across this anyway, and it was great!  Four of my family members stormed into this place and sat right down at a table at 10:30am on a Saturday morning. Those of you who don't understand, this is kickass in itself because 10:30 is when hangovers are waking up last night's drunks, and church is getting out. It's a terrible time to try to find food.....  ANYWAY, we all loaded up on coffee and to my delight of my mother, they offered not only decaf and regular, but also BOLD coffee. Nicely done. Downfall....they do not have actual cream for the coffees, only the non-refrigerated half and halfs.  The coffee was great, and then they brought out a cocktail tray of jellies to try. The jalapeño jelly was my favorite, but they had hoards of variety, and they sell them. I forgot to get some on the way out, but they were worthwhile to buy.  I ordered the party hash. Corned beef, ham, jalapeños, bell peppers, and a ton of other stuff that I drowned in the habanero sauce (that's really sweeter than hot), and it was literally one of the best breakfasts that I've eaten......ever (and I'm a huge breakfast fan and frequenter.)  I'd absolutely love to head here again, and I'm pretty sure that I will next time I'm in town.  Fair warning, you guys only have a few more months until I return, so you'd better fix that creamer issue and find some hotter peppers, or you'll be hearing about it. Thanks for the great meal though!

Reviews.Author: Autumn
Reviews.Content: Love how the party hash is a little spicy and their sauces and jams are homemade! So amazing I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I like this place. Everything is homemade and fresh. You can pick you own hash meats.   Even the jellies/jams are homemade and good.  Also: Anyone who mistakes this place for Hash House a Go Go is an idiot as that place is in Imperial Palace on the strip while this place is a little mom and pop Hash place in a little plaza corner.

Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: Mary's home made pumpkin pie and peach pie are exceptional. The best We've had.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Should've just stopped at McDonald's. SLOW service and unfriendly waitress. Any request was answered with a sour look. Took so long for the food to come and it was not anything special. The table next to us was sitting with dirty plates and old food the entire time we were here. Will not go back.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Home town food with great homemade jelly.  If you like breakfast this is the place.  Small, but very relaxing place.

Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Within the past six weeks, I renewed a love affair with HH, that started years ago when they were located on Spring Mountain.  I often wondered what had become of this wonderful Hash House until I located it on yelp.  There is was...the geographical location had changed but not the delicious chow, I remembered from yesteryear.    The new location offers a much larger dining area with the same waitress from days gone by running around serving hungry eaters.  Be patient with her, the food is worth it, even if the same lady (owner, Mary, I think) is not slaving away on the griddle.  The name of the game is HASH.  There are multiple variations to try.  My favorite is the party hash....not the kind you might be thinking because it would illegal but the edible persuasion.  It's got a little bit of everything, corned beef, roast beef, ham, chicken jalapeños, with mushrooms, all scrambled together.  If your a fan of jelly, they have homemade jelly here.  All sorts of delicious flavors to choose from.  I like the jalapeño flavor is sweet and sassy.  After writing this I am filled with a warm fuzzy and I am going to throw down another star!  This is not a commercialized monster you are bound to find in ever state while traveling down a major interstate.  It is a wonderful LOCAL restaurant, you should try for an awesome breakfast!!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I really don't write reviews here, but I have to let my voice be heard on how rude I was treated by  Mary .   Myself and 2 other co-workers ordered some food here.  He ordered a sandwich with fries, the other the San Diego omelette with hash, and myself tuna melt with fries.  When he got back we were all surprised to see that we all didn't get sides!!!! Not one of us.  Now I understand that if it said sides are extra on the menu but no it says  comes with your choice or sides!!! And to make it even more  wtf  my sandwich and my buddies omelette are in one box!!!!! Really  Mary ?!?! So I called and  Mary  answered it ( the reason I put quotations on this is because she said she was Mary the owner but you never know). So I told her that we didn't get any sides.  She replied that's how we ordered it......yes Mary all 3 of us decided we all don't want sides so that we can keep our figures.....OH NO!!! We are hungry boys working morning till night!!! I told her no we ordered 2 fries and one hash.  Her response was,  no you didn't . I also told her that even both my main order and my buddies main order were in the same box. Her response,  that's how you wanted it . Yes of course Mary we wanted our food together so that we can recreate the scene from Lady and the Tramp!!!  So then she just cut me short and ask,  so what do you want ......Excuse me?!?! I told her well cutting your attitude to a customer would be nice.  To which she replied again,  that's how you wanted it, so what do you want?   After that I asked her for her name and she said,  Mary, the owner.  Well Mary the owner.  Thank you for no sides even though you gave us a bottle of ketchup!!!! And thank your for your gracious attitude Mary! You remind me of the character  Mom  from Futurama.  Look it up Mary.....I will definitely not come here anymore. And will let everyone know about your attitude.  Like I said I don't do reviews unless it's super awesome service, or someone treated me bad.  You fell on that Mary.  Best of luck to you and your business....(also check out my pics on here on how our food was presented along with their menu)

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: The hash was delicious, my bacon and cheese omelets was yummy which I personalized by adding the country gravy on top. Server was a nice older lady but her priorities were definitely on the customers that appeared to be regulars. She brought out a tray full of a variety of homemade jams. We tried the strawberry, cherry and apple butter. YUM! They had 2 flavors of coffee regular and bold, and also offered flavored creamer!! They had vanilla, hazelnut and half and half creamers in the bowl she brought. On our way out I saw the display of the different jams for sale and without question i bought the apple butter. Came in a small mason jar maybe 8 ounces for $8, pretty expensive and I never spend that much on jams so you know it was good :) Apparently the owner Mary was on the tv show chopped the night before which I was unaware about. very cool though, will definitely be back and become a regular with the extra treatment haha

Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! The food is delicious! The variety of cinnamon rolls and jelly are the best! Mary the owner and also the chef is so very friendly and came out at the end of our breakfast to thank us for dining in! A must-try place for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

Reviews.Author: Yoli
Reviews.Content: I love this place .. The food was great and the waitresses were nice and met the owner . If you want a place where they will remember your name after only one visit,  this is the place . The jams are to die for . I will drive across town to get more jam .   Yes you do seat yourself, however I like the choice and I love the small town feel to the place that reminds me of the small home town I grew up in .   The food is great and the waffles and cinnamon buns are super yummy !!!

Reviews.Author: kaylyssa
Reviews.Content: I went here with my husband on Sunday at about 11am. The place was half empty, which should tell you something. We sat ourselves per the sign and grabbed our own menus. After about five minutes someone finally realizes we exist and the waitress takes our order. She greeted us by saying she was glad we were ready because she had a table of fifteen to get to. Okay... well yeah we're ready, we've been sitting here staring at the tiny menu for five minutes. I order and ask what the hash browns are like.  They're shredded.   Okay, are they crispy though?   Yeah,  she says in a huff. My husband orders the waffle special. After a million years, our order comes. My bacon and eggs were okay, not great. The  crispy  hash browns were mostly mush and tasted ENTIRELY of grease. Like no other flavor was present than straight up grease. My husband's teaspoon of eggs and two strips of bacon were also mediocre/okay (I gave him a few of my five slices of bacon). However his waffle was flavorless, served with a tiny shot flavorless syrup. I tried his waffle and couldn't even believe how the slightest hint of waffle flavor disappeared within milliseconds and left me chewing on a wet sponge. At some point while we were eating we were surprised by the sudden appearance of our check on the corner of our table. How did it get there? Did it float in on the breeze? Our waitress was nowhere to be seen. Which was too bad for us because we would have liked more napkins, water, and flavorless syrup. Oh well. I finished my meal by eating my toast with some of the jams, the apple butter was probably the best apple butter I've ever had, truly a star of a jam. That is why I gave 1 star to this place. If you come here you should just buy a jar of jam and leave.   Finally, having never heard from our waitress again (someone nearby flagged her down for napkins which of course caused her to spin around and vanish into thin air), I got up and paid with the check that had been delivered to us by a ghost. To my surprise, there was our waitress talking to the cashier! She was passionately bitching about another customer to the cashier who seemed to try to politely ignore her. The cashier was friendly to me but in no way did I feel bad about leaving a minuscule tip to match the service.   Ignore the good reviews! Eat somewhere else if you want to enjoy your breakfast in any way!

Reviews.Author: F
Reviews.Content: Short & Simple - service was beyond horrible, food quality was terrible and prices for the quantity were ridiculous!  Silverware was dirty and coffee tasted like tar...first and last time for us!  Waitresses and bus girl have terrible attitudes and look and act lazy!  Better off at Babycakes or Egg & I!  Bleh to Hash House!  Clean up your act!

Reviews.Author: Dahlenie
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness! I fell in love here! This place was not only affordable, but was DELICIOUS! The hash is home made! Also they make their own jams as well. I am a huge home made fan. Anything home made is always better. The portions were nice & big. Our server was very pleasant. It was pretty mellow when we went but I was very pleased. If you are in Vegas and looking for a great breakfast place that will cost you less than $25-30, for two people go here! I believe you won't be let down. I will be going there again when I visit Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: The bombest food in vegas. The price is right and the people are so nice. Five stars fosho!

Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: Seriously serious home cookin. Everything is a amazing. Usually a choice of 4 or more homemade jellies to choose from. Homemade sausage. What?! Yeppers homemade breakfast sausage. Everything to order. Been bringing my family here for years. Happy 20 years anniversary!!

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Extremely good service was amazing as well had the party hash with homemade spicy ketchup..... Perfect

Reviews.Author: Your Helping Hands
Reviews.Content: Mary and her staff have always made me feel right at home.  I make sure when I'm in town to stop by and have the  usual   Darlene will always ask whoever I bring in  why'd you bring her   and they always get a big laugh out of that.   The Hash is no where as greasy as most Hash is and it is very flavorful.  Mary is definitely old school diner mentality  she loves to cook and you will never walk in there and not see a smile on her face

Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I had the corned beef and hash, and it was pretty good, not amazing though... because it was a little dry.  My friends had the eggs and bacon breakfast and said it tasted like eggs and bacon (which is always a good sign).  Things that are awesome are the home made jellies in all different flavors (and I mean ALL DIFFERENT flavors like Sangria, Mandarin, Habanero, etc.), so you've got to try them out.  Also, their home made chipotle sauce is amazing  The spicy ketchup is more sweet than spicy, but that may have just been the batch that we got.  The juices come in a plastic bottle, so I am not so much a fan--I prefer fresh squeezed orange juice, or at least concentrate in a glass...   If the orange juice was better and the hash was less dry, this would be a five star; the jellies and home made sauces are the life savors for this place.  It's a little out of the way, but worth it to avoid the mess of the strip on Sunday morning.

Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to eat hash.  The word  hash  in reference to food made me uneasy, but I must say, I really enjoyed it.  Very moist and flavorful.  The homemade jams were also very tasty.  Attentive and friendly service...all in all...Enjoyable!

Reviews.Author: Katja
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delicious. Get something you would not normally get (I got the lamb hash) and you will not be disappointed! Great ambience and service.

Reviews.Author: Joey
Reviews.Content: My family enjoys  hole in the wall  type restaurants. And this place, although at a strip mall, has that type of feel with random framed pictures and various bird decorations all around. Service may be a little slow, but the staff is very nice.  There are no kid menus but the servers can rattle the items offered by memory.  We had the homemade cinnamon roll fresh from the oven. Not too sweet and you can taste the cinnamon.  Oatmeal came with warm milk & brown sugar. Simple but satisfying.  The Iced Coffee was tasty as well as their coffee which came in medium or strong. We tried the medium and it was  ok.  It had a different aftertaste to it.  They had homemade jellies. Yummy!  The waffles were tasty.  The biscuits and gravy were good but could have used a little more salt.  The bacon was awesome.  We asked for hard boiled eggs but they could only make poached.  Overall, if you want a satisfying breakfast, I would recommend that this place is worth a try.

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I don't see what the hype is about this place. While the food was good, it wasn't great, and it's breakfast, how can you mess that up? We tried two different hash dishes, eggs Mary and chicken fried steak and eggs. Hash was alright, nothing special. Eggs Mary was good but I've had better chicken fried steak and it was small. Our waitress was really good though and their homemade jellies are a nice touch.  At least I can say I tried the place but for me, it's not worth the trek off the strip.

Reviews.Author: Vinnie
Reviews.Content: We found this place on Yelp and gave it a try, I had the chicken hash which was dry and flavorless, like most white meat. I was hoping it would of had some seasoned dark meat in it. My wife had the ham hash which was more flavorful than mine. Their homemade sauces were good along with the jellies. My toast was burnt and placed upside down so I wouldn't notice it, the server was spread thin so we didn't get the attention we were expecting. When it started getting busy the owner Mary came out and helped tend to the customers.  If we come back I definitely wont order the chicken unless they start making it more moist. I'll probably try the ham instead.

Reviews.Author: Trish
Reviews.Content: We went to Hash House (not A Go Go) on purpose because it was the only restaurant in Las Vegas mentioned in Michael & Jane Stern's Roadfood book.  We had great service, delicious food (hash of course) and got to meet Mary herself!  She's such a neat person and even brought out her copy of the Savoire magazine that the restaurant was featured in recently.  We remarked afterward that you don't get to meet Bobby Flay, Emeril or Wolfgang Puck when you go their places.  We'll definitely recommend to anyone going to Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Marja
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the regular corned beef hash and the party hash. I do have to admit that on some bites you take, there is too much seasoning, but that is easy to get over with. The real stars for me with the restaurant would have to be the rye toast and homemade jellies. They are excellent!

Reviews.Author: Kuulei
Reviews.Content: THIS IS NOT HASH HOUSE A GO-GO! it is BETTER! #1 reason, no wait no big crowds, we were in & out of there in about 30 mins for our party of 2, we wanted somewhere fast but not fast food because we had an appmt soon. But it's also a small mom & pop place where you can bring the kids and have a nice family Sunday brunch. Can't wait to go back and try their famous home made jams/jellys and their party hash everyone raves about. Oh and they also mix their own ketchup, chipotle or habanero flavored, perfect for the ketchup+Tabasco combo lover like me!

Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Small & Cozy Midwestern Diner feel, SEAT YOURSELF. CLEAN-NOBoothes-All tables   Have a TV & Counter bar too Very friendly & attentive. MID-Western FOLK!! Felt like eating in MOM's kitchen Hearty portions, Lots of variety on the MENU, Fresh fruits, over 30 flavors of HOMEMADE Jam,Fresh breads and THE BEST HASH!! You could order Toast & JAM & have a GREAT meal & GeT FULL!!   Homemade JAMS toGO!!!! Top BREAKFAST Spot!!! Great FOOD , Atmosphere & service .If you are looking for some place you can eat EVERY day & have something NEW & delicious THIS IS IT!! VERY REASONABLY PRICED TOO!! Most everything us under $10!!!

Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Not only are the jellies good on toast, but I even put some on my Chicken hash after I ran out of Ketchup (To-Go). Only tried the Strawberry and Pineapple, but both were solid on the sourdough and full of flavor and pieces of the actual fruit. The Hash was tasty as well with shredded white meat chicken mixed in with onions, peppers and home fried potatoes. I should have gotten a different side, but I didn't know what kind of potatoes was orginally included, so I got double Home Fries basically. Will order fruit next time as the meal is pretty filling as it is and doesn't need two orders of potatoes. Eggs were cooked to my well done scrambled standards as well. Only $8 bucks, so a decent deal and if you dine-in you can try a bunch more of flavors of those jellies.   Its also pretty comical also about how the tourists don't realize what they are doing and wander in here. Probably 20% of their business! Classic.

Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: The service was pretty bad. The harried waitress repeatedly reminded us how busy they were. There were many empty tables but she was the only one working. She did come across as rude and impatient a few times however you could tell she was a nice person under stress. Clearly it was a management problem of understaffing.  The food: Strawberry waffles: very good. Fresh strawberries, which is a huge plus Jam assortment: awesome! We loved the variety of jams. A must have if you visit Blueberry pancakes: tasteless  Veggie hash: just okay Hash browns: a bit greasy, not very crispy Home fries: mushy, not good

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Super quaint mom and pop restaurant, located off the strip. Recommended for those who prefer a homey and cozy feel, as opposed to a chain hash restaurant. We only waited about 15 minutes to be seated BUT after we ordered our food- we waited about 1.5 hours until our food was actually served! At one point we were even debating on when to up and leave.  I suppose the delay was due to several factors: - Only 3 servers were waiting tables - 1 person cleaning tables and doing double duty as hostess.  - Observed 2 kitchen chefs cooking  We had 2 orders of corned beef hash, a chicken hash and a bowl of tomato basil soup. The food was delicious! I really enjoyed the corned beef hash. The hostess also provided us with samples of homemade jam to go with our toast. There were several flavors: watermelon, guava, pineapple, raspberry amd strawberry.   I would definitely come back again, if the wait was not as long. You can see that the servers were working really hard and they were always hustling. I would recommend for them to hire 1 or 2 more additional staff members. They definitely need the help.  Overall great food, but not for the person who is on the go, or in a time crunch. If the wait time between ordered food and served food was significantly less, I would have upped my rating to 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This was a first time visit only because the line at The Egg and I was more than I could bear.  A small, quaint, and well decorated place.  Seated ourselves and a normal wait before someone brought menues and took our orders.  I'm a coffee snob so wasn't going to order the coffee but asked about what they offered.  Farmer Brothers was their  house  coffee but they also offerred a Colorado River Roasting Company (Boulder City) fresh roated coffee, so I had that.  I recommend it to my fellow snobs. Be careful during refills because wait staff have no clue as to the difference and will pour you the Farmer Brothers.  I had biscuits and gravy and I was very disappointed.  My daughter had the corned beef hash and it was hortible.  My sons order had a grey hair in it.

Reviews.Author: Sassy
Reviews.Content: Great good great service. Everything home made. Best cinnamon rolls EVER. THANK YOU Mary & staff

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: You're in Vegas. What better way to continue the gluttinous theme by eating breakfast at Hash House? I went here twice, two days in a row. Although I didn't get a heart attack, if I did, it would be okay. I wasn't very satisfied with my first day's choice of entree: a large food competition-worthy banana pancake. Our waiter kept raving about how awesome it would be, but I think there was just too much of that and not enough bacon and eggs on the side. The freshly squeezed orange juice was delightful though. I managed to pick at some other friends' foods, including Chicken and waffle (with bacon bits!) .The second day, I stuffed my face in a Chicken biscuit/mashed potatoes dish (sorry can't remember the name), which completely compensated for the okay breakfast the previous day. The servings here are so large, even if you share with another person. Definitely a go!

Reviews.Author: Harrison
Reviews.Content: I don't know which came first, this place or Hash House A Go Go but I made the mistake of coming here thinking it was the latter.    Food wasn't spectacular, got one of the hashes that wasn't too flavorful.  The hash browns came out a bit raw, I like my hash browns with a crisp.  Nothing special but good portions.    There are better breakfast places out there

Reviews.Author: Stefany
Reviews.Content: I'm not a morning person or a breakfast person, but I can be persuaded to do a lot if my first stop is at Hash House. Not to be confused with HAGG, up the road, this place actually has good food and service.  Besides the hashes (just get the party hash that combines everything, watch out for the jalapenos, and you're good to go), there are omelets and my favorite dish, Mary's Eggs- which is Mary's take on eggs benedict. Two poached eggs on biscuits, topped with gravy and the best crispy bacon  you've ever had. Everything is sided with homemade grits (simply perfect with butter) and a bowl of fresh fruit.  Their lunch options include soups, salads, and sandwiches. Monday's cream of mushroom is my personal favorite, but they're actually all pretty solid. Only open til 2PM, so run in and grab your order to go if you need to.

Reviews.Author: Keo
Reviews.Content: This place is an awesome mom and pop establishment. Everything was home made and delicious. The hashes are phenomenal,  I had traditional and my wife had lamb. Both were great. They have a selection of home made jams/jellies to die for. Would've given them five stars but when we asked the other waitress for napkins she  told our waitress to get it for us and just stood their while we waited for it and they weren't even busy.   Go eat here the food is good

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Mary's hash house, not to be confused with hash house a go go, is terrible.  This place has the worst service I've ever seen.   I would love to tell you our servers name but she never said hello or introduced herself, she just said  drinks?   We ordered two iced tea. About 10 minute minutes later she came over, put our drinks down in front of us and just looked at us with a pen and pad.  No suggestions, no  what are you having,  she just looked us.  I had to ask her if she was ready, to which she responded with a shrug, as if I was wasting her time.  Mind you there where only 3 other tables with people at them in the whole place.  I should have know at that point that a breakfast joint with 6 other people in it on a Saturday morning was not the place to be.  Food took about 10 minutes, the check was dropped with the food and the server never returned.  We sat there with empty glasses for the rest of the meal.  I had the corned beef hash, my friend had the roast beef hash.  Both were ok, not great by any means but not bad either.  I read a few other reviews that said the hash was great compared to the canned stuff they are used to.  That right there should tell you everything you need to know about the food.  Back to service, the next time I saw our server she went up to the bar counter where they had what looked like cinnamon buns in glass presentation cases.  She opened up the glass presentation cases, and squeezed the buns with her bare hands to check the freshness.  Well I would say after that I had enough.  I wanted to try the  homemade deserts  but no one ever came back to check on us or to see if we needed anything else.  Also, after seeing how the handle the food out front where everyone can see imagine what's going on behind closed doors in the kitchen. I took our check to the unattended register, and stood waiting for someone to show up and cash me out, I should have just left, but being a bartender here l in town I wouldn't do that.  Our server showed up to cash me out, and just like at the table 30 minutes earlier she never said a word.  Not a  how was everything,  not a  thank you,  no  come back again,  nothing.  So I can assure you I will never return Mary's hash house!!!

Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: Though I have not sat inside to eat I have ordered take out a few times and everything I've tried has been boss. The only reason I gave 4 stars was because I so see room for improvement. I'd suggest maybe adding some seasoning to the fries. Maybe some salt/pepper or maybe some good old seasoning salt. Anyway keep up the awesome food making!

Reviews.Author: Keenan
Reviews.Content: I came in here to order some french toast. The french toast was decent though I can't believe they serve soda in the can. The service sucks and sucks bad. I was the only person trying to order and I literally waited about 20 minutes before someone came and took my order.

Reviews.Author: Arthur
Reviews.Content: We went here on accident thinking it was the Hash House a Go Go but the food was pretty good anyways. We didn't order anything special, but the service was attentive and better than expected.

Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the best breakfast in Vegas. I've lived here for 3 years and have tried Just about every breakfast spot in town.  Mary's menu is original and pretty extensive but what I like the most is that everything is always cooked perfectly.  We found out about the place when we saw an episode of chopped on food network and Mary was a contestant.  Her chicken is the absolute best and I don't really like chicken but my wife ordered it one day and I tried it and now I order it almost every time.  Best Chili in town too. Everything is made from scratch.  She makes her own extensive selection of jelly and unique ketchup.  She even makes homemade doggy treats.  This is a must go to breakfast spot in Vegas

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: Fantastic country breakfast. Love the homemade jam. Do not make the mistake of going to hash house a-go-go. This place is WAY better!

Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: Overall...super impressed!! Great GREAT food...everything is clearly fresh and did I mention the food is awesome?!  The party hash was delectable with the homemade Chipolte sauce. The waitress brought by about 10 different kinds of homemade jelly, so impressed with the quality!!

Reviews.Author: Rosetta
Reviews.Content: Just finished eating here.  We came here because of all the great reviews but also because we wanted to eat at Egg and I originally but the wait was too long.   2 1/2 stars from us.  When we entered we saw the sign to seat ourselves which was good as the restaurant wasn't crowded.  It took a good 5 minutes before we good tired of waiting for someone to come and hand us our menus so my husband decided to get our own.
