After 10 minutes of waiting someone came by yo ask us what we wanted to drink.   After ordering our breakfast it took a good 20 minutes for our food to come out.   What we ordered:  Raspberry cinnamon roll.  Very good.  Came our hot and had a nice chewy consistency.  Me:  Eggs Mary with grits and rye bread.  The food wasn't that hot considering it took so long to come out.  Rye bread was pretty good with their homemade jam but the jam wasn't that gourmet tasting.  Poached eggs were a bit rubbery.  Grits were a bit too thick and clumpy and luke warm.  Bacon was good though.  Son:  Eggs Mary.  They didn't bring out his sourdough toast but we couldn't be bothered to ask them for it.    Husband: Party hash.  I told him that I really wanted to try the hash as everyone on Yelp was raving on about how good it was which is why he ordered this.  Even before trying it or didn't look like anything that spectacular.  My husband said it wasn't that good but I still had to try it.  It was so so.  Not crispy and a bit bland but a lot of filling.  Disappointed as I was looking forward to good hash.   You would think the food would be hot as it took so long to cone out but it wasn't.  When we asked our waitress for the check she forgot about it as I had to ask her again.  Took a while for someone to process our payment even though we paid at the register.   My husband said the whole experience was very tiering.  I agree.    Would we recommend this place to others or come back?  Probably not.  Large portions but not good quality.

Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: Amazing hash! If you are looking for a friendly local breakfast or brunch diner then search no further. This place serves excellent food at reasonable prices. They are head and shoulders above that hash house a no no chain.

Reviews.Author: Chase
Reviews.Content: We DID mistake this place as HHAGG. Clearly we've never been there. We realized that 1/2 way through our meal.   Anyway, what we had was good. Pancakes, hashbrowns, and bacon were all good. My wife's veggie hash was reported as good although you'd have to tie me down to eat that crap.   We'd go again buy don't live in LV and probably never will.

Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: One of my most favorite breakfast spots in Vegas. Its never crazy crowded and I like that you can seat yourself. The staff is always so friendly and they never so busy that they forget you just walked in. I highly recommend the biscuits and gravy. Its usually on English muffins but the gravy itself it awesome!! I'm from Nashville so I'm pretty picky when it comes to gravy but this place got it right. Delicious!! The hash is amazing. I haven't had one I didn't like. The best part about this place is its small and cozy feeling and most important the food is great and doesn't break the bank to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Toria
Reviews.Content: Seeking an alternative to one of our favorite hash houses, we came upon this little beauty.. This little mamas and pop's greasy spoon (which is all I look for today for the original foods and taste)... Great people, A-1 service, money saving and the food was to die for.... When in Vegas, this will always be my go to...

Reviews.Author: Kaori
Reviews.Content: Man, despite the service deserving three stars or less (it's quite awful), I gotta hand it to this House for their awesome Hash. They've got homemade anything and everything. Loaves of bread, choco-chip cookies, coffee just the strength you like it, and jams and jellies you've certainly never tasted before.  Clearly this is beyond just hashing. Turkey hash, ham hash, roast beef hash, choices galore. Everything tastes just the way momma dreamed she could make it, if she lived on a farm.  I'd go again. It's different, tasty, and cheap!

Reviews.Author: Abba
Reviews.Content: I only gave this place one star because the home made jams was really tasty. My husband's soup was cold and there was a hair in my food. When it was time to pay we mentioned it to our waitress and got our food comped  wich was nice but no I'm sorry or anything. Customer service gose a long way.

Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Excellent traditional breakfast. Plenty of food for a 6'4  dude. Great friendly service

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: It's been a little while since we last had breakfast here, and I am once again reminded of why we love Hash House so much. The fresh, delicious food and the friendly service. Everything here is made from scratch, and Mary, Darlene, and Martha welcome you by name, like family, even though they are always busy.   This morning I tried the party hash for the first time, and it may be my new favorite. It's a mix of corned beef, roast beef, ham, and chicken hash with sautéed onions, mushrooms, peppers, and jalapeños, served with eggs and 2 sides. I do not enjoy super spicy food, so have been leery of the jalapeños in it. I needn't have been. They added just the right hint of spice. I also topped off the potatoes with homemade spicy ketchup and homemade chipotle sauce. Yum!  My husband had his usual: scrambled eggs with cheese, enormous homemade sausage patty, and 2 sides of grits with cheese. The sausage patty is hamburger-sized, and he loves it (even though he usually prefers links). I often waffle between one or another hash (corned beef, roast beef, lamb, super, duck, or lobster) and the waffle breakfast. I always enjoy whatever I choose, and Mary is always adding new items to the menu. I bring all my friends here, and they love it.

Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Mary is the king of breakfast. She has the HASH that will bring back memories. Her food is always fresh and well portioned. The major deal maker for this ultimate vegas breakfast is the Homemade Jelly, Apple butter is out of control. You can even purchase most of all the jellys to go in a nice mason Jar.  Over all 10 out of 10  Must try  better than any other Vegas brakfast joint.  A local Gem

Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: We waited 37 minutes to get our food and our waitress was a miserable excuse of a server. Towards the end of our meal, my husband and I were in agreement - we hate our waitress. HATED her. Okay, so we came here on a Saturday morning around 11AM. We tried Eggs & I first, but they had a wait time of 25 minutes. I think if we just would've waited there instead, we'd have been much happier.  WAFFLE SPECIAL ($7.55): A Belgian waffle served with 2 eggs and 2 slices of bacon. Gave the husband my bacon, who thought they were pretty delish. The waffle wasn't anything special, nor were the eggs. Very underwhelming. 2/5  CHICKEN HASH ($8.45): Ordered with a side of fruit and 2 eggs. My husband said the dish was bland. According to the menu, the chicken is 'garlic-poached', but my husband didn't detect any garlic undertones. 2/5   SERVICE: A white-haired woman with glasses greeted us as we walked in and seated us immediately. She was awesome. An older lady with short brown hair and no personality is what doomed our visit. When taking our food orders she walked up to the table and just stood there, silent. Finally, she mumbled  Need a moment? . We gave her our orders and she scurried away. She didn't interact with us until she brought some food to the table, which wasn't ours. She took the plates away and said  Oh I thought these were yours . Eons later, our food comes. Not once did she return to check up on us or offer refills. I would've liked more butter and syrup but seeing as how she avoided us, that never happened. Lady had a perpetual frown on her face. If you're not service oriented, you shouldn't be a waitress! Also, it irked me that the check wasn't itemized and that there weren't fountain drinks, only bottled cokes. 0/5  VIBE: Old-school breakfast diner complete with ceiling fans and box TVs.     Worth a Return Visit? Other waitresses seemed to be competent and friendly. We got the bad apple. The food was unimpressive and took waaay too long to arrive at our tables. There's a problem in the kitchen and a problem with service here.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #218

Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: I gotta say, after reading some of the reviews, I came here expecting to have a descent meal & friendly service. Unfortunately I left the cafe not so happy and kinda disappointed. I'm gonna make my reasons short & sweet: depressing & gloomy atmosphere, no garlic in my chicken garlic hash, chipped water glass & last but not the least the food server who was neither friendly nor attentive. She never smiled, checked on my table, dropped the check with food & disappeared. The price was ok as well as quality of the food. In a city like Vegas with thousands of dining options, one would think small businesses like that go beyond their way to make costumes enjoy their experience. It one sentence, felt like dining at a truck stop in the middle of nowhere with a grumpy server who hates her job.

Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when I walked in but if it's been around for 20 something years? or so I thought to myself it has it has to be good? It was a Sunday morning and there a bunch of open tables. We were told to pick a table so we did. After that it took a good 20 minutes before the lady came back to get our order and I was a bit annoyed because other tables who came in after us was getting their order taken. However, they had a different server so I'm not sure why our server was slow.   We ordered and the kids menu is very minimal. I ordered the original corned beef and hash with over medium eggs. My eggs came out sunny side up and runny all over the place. My corned beef hash was like burnt hash browns. The flavor was lacking and it was just overly crispy except for my eggs. On the plus side she asked if I wanted all of the peppers and onions and she was able to omit those.   Overall I did not enjoy the food at all. Cool that they have homemade jelly but it didn't balance out that I had burnt food. Service was mediocre at best but it is what it is. I definitely would not come back when there are so many other breakfast places that are awesome.

Reviews.Author: Johnie
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find out this great breakfast and lunch restaurant has been open since 1994.  I'm a new fan of Mary's party hash and the cinnamon roll is out of this world.  If you are in Las Vegas and looking to get the best breakfast in town - it's worth taking a drive off the strip or from anywhere in the city.  You will not be disappointed .  Love the Midwest vibe and cooking .  Staff is very friendly and make sure you say hi to Mary - she is fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: for great comfort food this is the gem of in las vegas ..... only open for breakfast & lunch 6am to 2pm.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: So we decided to try a local place while on vacation in Las Vegas. Was prepared to be let down once again by another 4 star YELP rating as we have been soo many times in the past. It is good, but not great. Ordered the Roast Beef Hash, it is  Hash House  afterall.....and it was just lacking in flavor. Tried some Corned Beef Hash from another member of our party, and it was like night and day...stick with the Corned Beef. Eggs and potatoes pretty standard diner fare. The homemade jellies and sauces are a nice touch.   Good place for an off the strip breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: Take a bow Mary!!! Amazing food with a down home feel. Best Monte Cristo I have had in years!! Get the jellies to sample!!

Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: Came here on a recommendation from a friend, ordered the party hash with fresh fruit and toast.  The lady that sat and served me was pretty curt and uninterested, whereas she was chummin it with who I assume were some locals.  No biggie, as long as the food's good I can take or leave sociability to be honest.  Good, however, is not the word I finally chose to describe the food I consumed.  The party hash consists of everything in the super hash, with mushrooms and jalapenos to boot.  While I was eating, I found myself thinking,  if the party hash is this bland, how the hell must the super hash taste (without mushrooms and jalapenos)??   After the hype (which could barely be qualified as  hype,  maybe better described as mild promotion) it was a let-down.  Fresh fruit was some pitiful watermelon cuts and banana slices.  The jelly was VERY good (IMO the best thing about the place).  It was THE only aspect of our entire interaction that the server displayed any modicum of enthusiasm (not that I need some f*in Carrot-Top server, but she was definitely a downer).  In this though, she came to the table with a tray of jelly options and offered it to me for the toast.  It was impressive and delicious =D  Again, that really is the only good thing about the place.  It's called Hash House and I tried what was supposed to be one of the sig dishes, and yet I think my Pops enjoyed his biscuits and gravy much more than I enjoyed my meal.  If you're starving, and you're there, go ahead, but I'd probably try something OTHER than one of their hash dishes, and DON'T SKIP the toast and jelly

Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: Located in a strip mall, the exterior is a bit dire, but once you get inside, that all fades away  Quirky, unique menu, huge portions, and super tasty. Had an omelette, and my dining partner had (what else) hash. Service was great and very fast. Server was accommodating without being overbearing. The homemade jellies were a nice surprise. Never would have thought jalapeno apple jam would be something I would eat, but it was very tasty.  Would absolutely visit again.

Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Confort food at its best! My wife introduced me to this delightful place. One of those hidden gems I hope stays open for a very long time. The breakfast sausage patties are so good!!!!

Reviews.Author: Harlan
Reviews.Content: They were featured on the food network and were voted one of the best places to have breakfast in Las Vegas by Rachael Ray. My wife and I had one the best meals in a long time. Everything is homemade including the jellies. We will be back to have their lunch specials

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Hands down, by far Mary's Hash House is the most original  Mom & Pop Shop  I've ever been to.  We were greeted by the owner Mary who had a big smile on her face while carrying out a fresh batch of Cinnamon Rolls.  I ordered their holiday special S'mores Coffee and blueberry Oatmeal-which was actually blueberry flavored Oatmeal!  Their menu had a huge selection of Hashes, homemade low carb bread, pumpkin french toast, stuffed meatloaf ect....OMG!  EVERYTHING is homemade-even their Jellies, which they bring out in 20+ different flavors on a sterling silver platter to you.  Seems that all the servers have worked here 10+ years, which doesn't surprise me since the feeling of family really resonates here.  Super excited to be a regular returning customer and happy I found a true home style meal in Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: the boss likes the corned beef hash and thinks it is some of the best in town so we gave it another chance. I tried the western omelette this time. It was fine, nothing special. I tried the homemade peach jelly and the pineapple jelly and both were good. The true problem with this place is the service. There is no other way to describe it except bad. Friendliness, refills, and checking in your clients just doesn't seem to be part of the waitresses job. The service makes for a very unejoyable experience.

Reviews.Author: Gilda
Reviews.Content: We stopped by on our way home to L. A. and we were so glad we did! The eatery is quaint, very clean and the waitresses are kind and helpful.   We ordered the French toast stuffed with cream cheese and warm blueberry compote, bacon and spinach egg white omelette and the pulled pork hash with over hard eggs. Everything was delicious and well seasoned.   We definitely make this our go-to place when we are in town!

Reviews.Author: Annie Laurie
Reviews.Content: Great home-made corned beef hash and eggs. Terrific service and tasty dishes.  A place to enjoy a delicious breakfast!

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I like this place because it is like going to a friends and eating good food.  They have friendly service.  It is a simple no fuss mom and pop joint.  Nice quiet place for breakfast.  I always get the corned beef hash.  I like the corned beef hash because it has to be homemade.  This is easily the best corned beef hash I have ever had in Vegas.  They usually do a good job on basting my egg too. The breakfast comes with plenty of food.   This is a nice little breakfast spot.

Reviews.Author: Colleen
Reviews.Content: Soooooooo good and so fresh.. Love this place!  Great homemade food with a ton of healthy, YUMMO options on their menu.  Because everything is fresh to order do NOT expect to get in and out in a heart beat..

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Hash House is probably my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas.   I know corned beef hash is an acquired taste but I love the stuff and this place does it best.  I also love all the homemade jams on thick whole wheat toast.   I've had the hotcakes several times as well and they are awesome!   This place is small and does get busy sometimes but have a little patience!  The owner is usually there is friendly and always checks up on my food.

Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I come here often. They have great food. Love the selection of jellies, but raspberry is the best. Prices are very affordable. Mary's is great.
